title: FSI Candidate
description:
FSI Candidate
Location: San Antonio, TX (remote until 10/1)
Duration: 12 months
Start: Immediate
Rate: plus expenses possible flex for strong candidate
Visa: H1B ok  NO TRANSFERS (communication needs to be 10/10)
 
 
Second Line is definitely applied a bit inconsistently across the industry, but the basics here are that First Line own and operate the processes and controls that the business run on (so they write, implement, and operate the policies, procedures, and control environment), while Second Line looks over their shoulders to opine on whether those policies, procedures, and control environment are designed appropriately to cover all the relevant risks (all types of risk – compliance/regulatory risk, financial risk, and operational risk).  If the whole Second Line function were to disappear, all the processes to safely operate the company should still be able to function.  So Second Line is the group that’s performing checks (risk assessments and risk monitoring) as well as providing effective challenge (a risk-focused review) of the policies, procedures, and controls designed and operated by the first line.
 
Skills:
 
MUST HAVES
 
Skills – hopefully visible in resume:
o             Measured in years, not months
o             PCI experience itself is not being accepted for the FSI piece
 
Travel
 
When submitting, please include:
o             Provide a description of their background with second line at a financial services institution
o             If higher level candidates (former management, CISO)
o             Confirm they are open to hands-on roles where their day-to-day tasks will be directed and observed by a manager
o             Include candidate’s response to following question: “How much of their cumulative experience was spent in the trenches doing the work?”
 
Communication – Must be 10/10
 
Experience performing second line effective challenge / risk assessment in FSI, along with solid Information Security technical experience (meaning hands-on technology work); Knowledge of FFIEC Handbooks, NIST CSF, NIST 800-53 risk frameworks and others.  Experience designing and evaluating InfoSec processes, risks and controls.
 
- 50% - Solid Cyber/InfoSec Control Procedure, Control Development and Control governance framework experience (e.g. NIST CSF, COBIT 2019)
- 25% - Vulnerability Management, Security Configuration Management (e.g. Firewalls, Web Proxies, Intrusion Detection/Intrusion Prevention), Encryption, or Cyber Incident Response
- 25% - Cyber/InfoSec Process development/review and challenge (covering Process, Risk, Control Inventory work)

Immunomic Therapeutics is looking for highly motivated Post Doc/Scientist with experience in hybridoma-based antibody discovery and development. The scientist is expected to performing the antibody screening with ELISA and/or Flow cytometry; DNA/protein sequence analysis of hybridoma hits; and the antibody functional evaluation.

title: Smarts Admin Developer
description:
We are looking for resources for an engagement in Canada for a customer.This is to configure Smarts to monitor a customer's Equipment Ascend platform for the Gov't of Ontario.
 Smarts admin developer proficient in ASL scripting and Dynamic Modelling - expert level skills (5-10 years of experience)
General implementation tasks are completed early on in effort to ensure project delivery time-frames that meets expectations and that provides a "quick-win for our client. These general services for development and implementation include:
- Review operational objectives from client stakeholders.
- Analysis of current data input files for development of parsing and general solution.
- Analysis of current customerdiscovery results for instantiation of customer objects in Smarts.
- Review of any best practices or policies that our client requires for contractors.
- Discuss the approach for the client maintaining the solution long-term.
- Discuss any challenges with accessibility (security, access, etc.) that could impact current engagement efforts or deliverables.
- Analyze and plan for any production deployment constraints (production scheduling, change windows, etc.) that could impact deployment.
- Build and compile models and Classes in Smarts for customerContainers and Zones.
- Leverage input file sourced by NetIQ for object instantiation of Containers and Zones.
- Leverage customerOID and SNMP instrumentation for discovery and object instantiation as potential supplement to asset identification/discovery/sourcing.
-Create and instantiate new Classes in Smarts for creating instances using input data.
-Compile new models into Smarts monitoring platform (SAM, IP).
-Build/develop Driver in Smarts for establishing topology across customerZones and Containers.
-Establish Parser and parsing logic for data input.
-The developed Parser will process the input (file or discovery) and call the driver in Smarts to instantiate the model and create instances in Smarts. The logic will also establish the relationships between customerZones and the underlying Containers.
Regards
Divyansh Srivastava

title: Graphic Specialist/Web Designer
description:
Pegasus Technologies & Solutions, Inc. is seeking to hire a Graphics Specialist/SharePoint Web Designer. This candidate will be responsible for Graphic/Visual Communications and SharePoint development for the Project Manager, Unmanned Aircraft Systems (PM UAS), located on Redstone Arsenal.  Duties include the oversight and coordination with outside vendors in order to meet specified goals.  Required skills include: graphic design, creation of high-end publications, presentations, branding, video, multi-media, photography, animation, 3D graphics, and SharePoint website design/development.  Performs analysis of customer requests and needs, and works independently from drafting of the initial rough concept phase through creation and delivery of the final product.
Graphic design includes:
• The creation of logos, illustrations, briefings, desktop publishing, and maintenance of brand uniformity throughout the organization in support of PM UAS.  Final products range from display graphics for trade shows, illustrations for publications and briefings, business cards, building signage, Change of Charter programs, invitations and photography, cd/dvd creation, duplication and printing, and document production. 
• Responsible for creative concept, design, layout, collection of articles/photos, editing and printing of the PM UAS Newsletter and the quarterly PM UAS Magazine, as applicable. 
• Collects information and compiles video for PM UAS “Update to the Workforce”. 
• Video/multi-media duties range from the initial capturing of video to producing an edited, finished product which may either be used in other videos, Town Hall Meetings, or may stand alone. Tasks associated include video recording, editing, sound editing, and title production. 
• Photography tasks include documenting Change of Charters, retirements, PM UAS events, ISO photos, passport photos, equipment photos, and vehicle demonstrations. 
• 3D graphics include constructing the 3D models, setting scenes, lighting, animation, and rendering.
SharePoint/Web design includes:
• Design and development of custom web pages within the framework of the existing PM UAS Intranet Site, which is based on SharePoint. 
Required Qualifications:
• Proficient with MS Office, SharePoint, and Adobe Software
• Excellent written and verbal communications skills
• High School Diploma, Bachelor’s Degree preferred 
• 5-7 years of directly related work experience 
• US Citizenship is required
• Active secret clearance, or the ability to obtain one will be required
Pegasus is an equal opportunity employer.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, union status and/or beliefs, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

title: Web Application Developer
description:
We are seeking a talented Web Application Developer to develop, maintain and enhance complex database centric web application software in support of U.S. Army scientific research objectives. This position will be on-site with our Army customer and require familiarity with a broad set of web software development and software engineering skills.  The developer will be the lead responsible for maintaining and extending a set of custom web-based applications written in PHP and using SQL to interact with data in a MySQL database. The PHP applications are written using the CakePHP framework so experience with this is preferred, but previous use of other similarly structured programming frameworks is acceptable.
The developer will be the lead responsible for maintaining and extending a set of custom web-based applications written in PHP and using SQL to interact with data in a MySQL database. The PHP applications are written using the CakePHP framework so experience with this is preferred, but previous use of other similarly structured programming frameworks is acceptable.
The existing applications include capabilities for:
Inserting, modifying and deleting data into the database with associated error checking.
Loading externally generated Excel data files into the MySQL database.
Providing process for a variety of needs which in most cases include the uploading of user files and automated generation of PDF documents email notifications providing for review and approvals of a variety of work flows throughout the organization.
Generating a variety of reports for on-screen display and also for on demand Excel file generation.
Generating onscreen graphs.
This position will enhance and extend these existing capabilities.
Due to the sensitivity of customer related requirements, U.S. Citizenship is required.
Experience with database centric business web applications.
Minimum of 5 years of experience directly with development of database centric web applications or 10 years of more general web application development experience with 2 years of experience with database centric web applications.
Proficiency with PHP, SQL and familiarity with the MySQL database software.
PHP Web development framework.
The programmer must also be able to interact with stakeholders to identify and decompose system requirements. 
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Experience with CakePHP web development framework preferred.
Experience with team programming and structured programming experience preferred.

description:
Designs and develops interfaces and solutions for web pages, sites, and services within the public and private web sites for Business & Support Services Division, MR. Interprets and refines user requirements, designs technical site plans, test plans, database use, layouts, navigation and other technical specifications. Develops site functionality, features, navigation, user interface, backend connectivity, access, security and change management utilizing specified web development tools.
Plans and performs web development tasks to include programming, integration of reusable code and database; conducts job estimates; implements quality control measures. Incorporates text, graphics, pictures, objects, video, sounds, and all required media enhanced effects as required.
Conducts site maintenance, troubleshooting and problem solving. Maintains high level of proficiency with prescribed development tools and products. Conducts research for web design and development, to include tools, technologies and methodologies, and makes recommendations. Collaborates with the customer and Business Analyst, other web developers, web designers, web administrator, application developers, database designers and other technical staff as appropriate to deliver web-based products and services.
Plans, organizes work, and follows internal procedures and resources to ensure maximum productivity and economies. Monitors programs on a regular basis, and initiates corrective action to ensure support of operating programs. Develops long-range plans in conjunction with internal operating directives.
Effectively supports the Marine Corps Equal Employment Opportunity and Sexual Harassment policies, and ensures compliance with fire, safety, and other environmental issues and programs. Maintains and enforces security of funds, merchandise, supplies and equipment to preclude or minimize the potential for fraud, waste and abuse.
Provides World Class Customer Service with an emphasis on courtesy. Assists customers and communicates positively in a friendly manner. Takes action to solve problems quickly. Alerts the higher level supervisor, or proper point of contact for help when problems arise.
Adheres to safety regulations and standards. Promptly reports any observed workplace hazards, and any injury, occupational illness, and/or property damage resulting from workplace mishaps to the immediate supervisor. Adheres to established standards of actively supporting the principles of the EEO program and prevention of sexual harassment. This is a white-collar position where occasional lifting up to 20 lbs may be required.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field and four years web application development experience, leveraging modern web standards such as HTML5, ASP.Net, JQuery, JavaScript, SQL, PowerShell, XML, CSS and client side development in JavaScript or any JavaScript framework.
Or an appropriate combination of education and experience that demonstrates possession of knowledge, skills and experience equivalent to that gained above. Both Web Forms and MVC experience will be considered. Experience with third party control vendors such as Telerik or DevExpress is highly desirable.
Knowledge of SharePoint 2010/2013 to include administration and development. Thorough understanding of SharePoint architecture to include farm topology, managed paths, site collections, and other related topics.
Candidate familiarity with SharePoint taxonomy, metadata, content management, collaboration, custom web part development, reporting, and search services. Planning and implementing SharePoint disaster recovery solutions. Previous experience as an Administrator and Workflow development is a plus.
Knowledge of Server Administration to include Web server / IIS administration. Experience with Web Service Development, such as REST API Web service. Experience with database design and development, and mobile or online shopping site development is a plus.

title: Web Developer (.NET / Cloud)
description:
Web Developer (.NET / Cloud) - Contract - Beaverton, OR 
The end client is unable to sponsor or transfer visas for this position; all parties authorized to work in the US without sponsorship are encouraged to apply.
A Financial Company is seeking a Web Developer (.NET / Cloud) in Beaverton, OR. 
Role Description
* Develops and reviews requirements, ensuring that there is agreement on what software is to be built.
* Synthesizes design, incorporates review comments and provide critical review of other designs.
* Often responsible for creating and documenting the architecture and design for several interrelated components, which are subsequently developed by other engineers.
* Writes production-quality code and is able to implement entire subsystems or feature sets independently. Software developed should have very few defects, should be robust in the face of environmental errors, should perform at or beyond requirements, and should be able to be understood by more junior developers.
* Builds and tests code to validate functionality against requirements.
* Facilitates code inspections and design reviews. Mentors others on software development practice.
* Participates in establishing large and/or complex project goals, milestones and timetables.
* Accurately estimates and tracks personal work. Helps other engineers create accurate estimates.
* Communicates accurate status to managers and project managers.
* Coordinates work with project managers and other engineers. Develops and maintains strong relations with clients, partners, peers and other associates.
* Identifies project responsibilities outside of the standard implementation process and coordinates with the appropriate area.
* Assists in the development and presentation of manuals, user guides, and other materials relating to client products.
* May provide staff and clients with training and technical assistance relating to new, existing, and revised products.
* Provides post-release support to internal and external customers.
* Helps identify closed loop corrective action for removing process defects in the software development life cycle.
* Demonstrates self-development by attending courses and conferences. Routinely presents topics and training to other software developers..
Skills & Requirements
* Four-year degree plus graduate work in software engineering, computer science, computer engineering or equivalent experience is required. During this time should have written programs of significant complexity (several thousand lines).
* At least 7 years' experience writing software in a production environment, preferably in product development setting. Software development experience should include distributed server solutions with rigorous quality, scalability, robustness and reliability requirements.
* At least 4 years' experience with Microsoft technology stack (.NET, C#, RESTful API Web Services, ASP.NET, etc)
* At least 4 years' experience with Cloud Computing technologies (Azure, AKS, GCP, etc)
* Proven practical experience with software product development/management processes and software configuration management.
* Proven project or sub-project technical leadership. Experienced with project management tools and techniques. Able to manage multiple tasks and meet assigned deadlines.
* Ability to assess and inspect coding practices and review software designs.
* Good interpersonal and written communication skills

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:
• Understands customers’ processes and products and how they fit within the goals of the business unit
• Reviews and validates the detailed technical design for business applications provided by the supplier to ensure alignment with business requirements
• Validates suppliers estimates Estimates Rough Order of Magnitude for the level of effort/cost of new application functionality

• Performs impact analysis of application changes across various components, holding an end-to-end view of the system

TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS:

• Most recent 5-7+ years experience in building Single Page Application (SPA) framework such as AngularJS, Angular5/6/7, Vue.js

title: PHP Software Engineer
description:
Very successful company filling a unique demand for targeted broadcasting to supporters and fans of large social groups such as political parties, government agencies, health information bodies as well as sports figures and stars in the entertainment industry and many others with large social following.  Your contribution will be recognized and much appreciated.
The company is following all recommended health and safety practices put into place to mitigate the spread of Covid 19 and all staff are currently working remote, mostly in at home offices.  Eventually, when it is considered safe to do so, they will reopen their facilities in Highlands Ranch.  Accordingly all interviews will be conducted using video communication apps.
 
New opportunity for PHP Software Development Engineers with a fast growing company in Highlands Ranch providing real time interactive large scale streaming and telephonic IP broadcast communications services.
 
RESPONSIBILITIES
* Supporting the existing LAMP based application and infrastructure. Finding areas for improvement, suggesting changes, and owning those changes.
* Utilizing and assisting our Quality Assurance team to make and release the best software possible.
* Helping the Operations team maintain the quality of our platform events that our partners and clients have come to expect. 
* Ensuring the smooth operation of the platform during high stress, high congestion moments.
* Being a vital resource for other engineers, quality assurance engineers, and leadership. 
REQUIRED EXPERIENCE and QUALIFICATIONS
* More than two years experience with PHP in a development environment and a desire to become expert in all things PHP.
* Expertise with frontend development: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery and/or any of the JS frameworks.
* Knowledgeable with Classes, interfaces, design patterns, encapsulation, inheritance, polymorphism and object-oriented programming.
* Familiar with working in an Agile software development environment
* Must be a natural communicator with other developers, IT support team, management, business analysts, marketing and other non tech staff.
* Record of taking ownership of a feature or application from concept through release while assisting others when the need arises.
* Experience working with QA doing Unit and automated testing.
* Some familiarity with Python and node JS would be advantageous

title: Front End Web Developer - Senior
description:
Looking for a driven, results-oriented Software Applications Engineer who shares our passion for technology, innovation and quality. 
As a front-end engineer, you will be a senior member of our engineering team that is responsible for the web front-end that powers the Digital Communications Platform. Over the past year, we have been working to demise an existing communications solution, replacing a vendor-based SaaS solution with an in-house, yet vendor-built Java+Angular solution backed by the OpenText Exstream and Empower rendering products. Expect to collaborate closely with product, design, vendor, and backend teams to build and support new features, drive technical direction, and build scalable web apps targeting modern browsers in a way that meets architectural standards and operational needs.
What you’ll do:
• Partner with Product/Platform Teams, Vendors, and Designers to deliver a beautiful user experience
• Collaborate as a technical lead and SME in the area of front-end design & development
• Influence the features and direction of the product with your own ideas
• Facilitate integration with existing and/or new data services
• Participate in an agile software development environment
• Participate in design, code, and technical design reviews
• Participate in and ferry solutions through local and/or other governance reviews
• Integrate performance monitoring to empower data-driven decisions
• Investigate and resolve application issues reported by our end users and business partners
• Identify ways to improve our technology, process & performance
• Solve production problems and participate in a 24x7 on-call rotation and related installs
• Provide recommendations and improvements to prevent production incidents from re-occurring
• Participate in key incident reviews / production issues calls to investigate and restore key application issues, outages or major impacts from related domains and perform post mortem / root cause analysis as needed.
• Configure and monitor new alerts, as needed, to prevent production issues from affecting application availability.
• Proactively monitor and continually seek for on-going improvements for our applications.
• Create dashboard to publish alerts or proactively identify issues raised after key releases to keep all applications and batch processes performing at its best
• Automate routine tasks with your own scripts and open-source tools
• Write documentation and collaborate with technical peers. Update and/or author new documents to share with the others in the Ops team.
• Mentor junior developers in design patterns, best practices and software development strategy
 
• Bachelor of Science in Computer Science or Master of Computer Science 
• 10+ years overall IT experience
• 7+ years demonstrated real world experience in enterprise web application development 
• 7+ years demonstrated real world experience in object oriented languages such as Java and/or C# (.NET or Core) 
• 7+ years demonstrated real world experience in software engineering principles, practices, and software design patterns in an Enterprise level environment. 
• 7+ years demonstrated real world experience in DevOps, Full stack development with Angular, .Net, or similar. 
• 7+ years demonstrated real world experience in database principles, such as SQL, Oracle, or MongoDB 
• Experience in RESTful service design and implementation 
• Experience with mobile friendly web application development (hybrid or native a plus) 
• Firm grasp of UI/UX principles, ability to convert UX designs into working prototypes 
• Experience producing technical design documentation and reviewing with architects 
• Experience using PaaS solutions and concepts (PCF and/or GCP preferred) 
• Experience leveraging Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment and DevOps principles 
• Working knowledge and understanding of security tools like Veracode and AppScan 
• Expertise in the software development lifecycle with proven examples of process improvement 
• Working knowledge of Agile / Scrum development methodology 
• Experience with Atlassian suite of products to include JIRA, Confluence, Bitbucket & Bamboo 
• Demonstrated yearning to leverage technology to build products that "wow" users 
• Self-motivated as well as creative and efficient in proposing solutions to complex, time-critical problems 
• Excellent analytical skills with demonstrated ability to solve problems 
• Strong verbal and written communications skills. 
• Experience mentoring and guiding developers 
• Strong ability to partner with product managers, engineers, and architects across the organization through collaborative problem solving 
• Experience with modern 24x7 production environments 
• Has experienced in using ITIL framework best practices for Incident, Problem and Change management 
• Able to speak with confidence and under pressure during technical troubleshooting calls to resolve and restore production issues; able to articulate key topics to different audience levels. 
• Understands Operational needs and key processes to ensure application availability and stability continue to improve. 
• Hands on experience in tools like IBM RAD, Websphere application servers, AppDynamics, AES, Splunk, Toad, etc 
• Experience in financial services and bank/ lending environments

title: Senior Web App/HTML5 Developer (Greenwich,CT)
description:
For more than 40 years, Interactive Brokers has been at the forefront of the Fintech space, and we pride ourselves on being a technology company. Employees at Interactive Brokers constantly challenge the status quo, breaking boundaries on every level to offer the advanced trading platforms with the most sophisticated features for our growing customer base. And all at the lowest costs.
Do you have solid Web App skills that you’re ready to put to the test as a hands-on contributor on a complex, large-scale real-time project? Do you have the drive to make features work seamlessly and efficiently with one another, and pride yourself on building beautiful and easy to use UIs? If you answered yes, then join us!
We’re looking to hire a talented Senior Web App Developer to be a key player in one of our company’s most critical initiatives, as we both expand our trading app offerings and modernize our UI using Vue.js toolkit.
Interactive Brokers ("IBKR"), a subsidiary of publicly-traded Interactive Brokers Group, Inc., based in Greenwich, Connecticut (IEX: IBKR) is a low-cost provider of trade execution and clearing services for active traders, institutional investors, financial advisors and introducing brokers. IBKR’s premier technology provides electronic access to stocks, options, futures, forex, bonds, and funds worldwide from a single IBKR Integrated Investment account. IBKR is one of the largest online brokers by trade volume and is consistently ranked at the top of its field.
Our employees are part of a dynamic, multinational, fast-paced, results-oriented team working to provide our customers with state-of-the-art trading technology, superior execution capabilities, worldwide electronic access, and sophisticated risk management tools.
Our headquarters are in Greenwich, CT, USA. IBKR has offices in the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, Switzerland, Hungary, Estonia, Russia, India, Hong Kong, China, Japan and Australia.
IBKR is a member of NYSE, FINRA, and SIPC. Interactive Brokers Group brokerage affiliates are regulated by securities and commodities agencies around the world.

title: Java/Javascript Developer (NYC)
description:
IBG LLC seek a Java + Javascript developer to extend our growing market surveillance group. The successful candidate will help develop our market surveillance tool, built in Java and Vue.js.
Interactive Brokers ("IBKR"), a subsidiary of publicly-traded Interactive Brokers Group, Inc., based in Greenwich, Connecticut (NASDAQ: IBKR) is a low-cost provider of trade execution and clearing services for active traders, institutional investors, financial advisors and introducing brokers. IBKR’s premier technology provides electronic access to stocks, options, futures, forex, bonds, and funds worldwide from a single IBKR Integrated Investment account. IBKR is one of the largest online brokers by trade volume and is consistently ranked at the top of its field.
Our employees are part of a dynamic, multinational, fast-paced, results-oriented team working to provide our customers with state-of-the-art trading technology, superior execution capabilities, worldwide electronic access, and sophisticated risk management tools.
Our headquarters are in Greenwich, CT, USA. IBKR has offices in the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, Switzerland, Hungary, Estonia, Russia, India, Hong Kong, China, Japan and Australia.
IBKR is a member of NYSE, FINRA, and SIPC. Interactive Brokers Group brokerage affiliates are regulated by securities and commodities agencies around the world.

title: Web & Usability Designer - Intermediate
description:
If interested please reach out to atanderson@apexsystems.com
The UI/UX Designer will design usable solutions for corporate websites and applications, based on corporate goals, contemporary web design principles and user data. They will be responsible for designing the optimal web flow for conversion. This person will also be required to perform some usability testing in order to influence and support their designs. Candidates will need to work independently as well as take direction, work closely with other teams, and should be self-motivated and organized Responsibilities:
* Partner with business units, development teams, QA and other stakeholders to design and define the user experience (visual and information architecture) across a suite of web-based sites and services.
* Create supporting documentation for Web sites and services that improve the user experience and ensure site success including tutorials, demos, and low-fidelity prototypes.
* Design incremental improvements and added features within existing Web sites and services to maintain consistency and ensure an optimal user experience and easy to use information architecture. Minimum Requirements:
 * Bachelors Degree in related field and 2+ years of professional experience
 * Solid understanding of web technologies (HTML, CSS, Javascript/JQuery)
* Ability to apply theories related to color schemes, use of space, text placement, usability and visual flow
* Experience designing and producing usable online solutions
* Ability to take direction and work with minimum supervision
* Ability to be efficient, productive, and flexible with a dynamic workload
* Strong communication skills and the ability to work within project schedules and deadlines.
* Knowledge of design for responsive and mobile environments Proficiency with the following tools/technologies:
* Photoshop (or Illustrator, InDesign, QuarkXPress)
* Microsoft Office
* Web Usability
* Usability Testing Working knowledge of the following tools:
* Acrobat * Both PC and Mac environments
* HTML/CSS Once your application has been received, you may be asked to provide a minimum of five examples from your portfolio (web projects only).

A Software Company is seeking a Senior React Developer (JavaScript / REST) in New York, NY. 
Role Description
Hays is recruiting for a React Developer who will work with local and offshore development, designers, and QA team members to develop a best of breed FinTech application. The agile team works iteratively to develop the web and mobile user interfaces for a complex application that allows advisors and their clients to transform their financial investment engagement to a digital experience. The person taking the position will be responsible for working collaboratively in a highly dynamic and fast paced environment.
Skills & Requirements
* 4+ years experience developing in JavaScript browser-tier applications
* Strong experience developing React (2+ years)
* Experience with any other framework (Angular 2.0, Vue.js) and/or JQuery
* Strong experience with REST/GraphQL and other API mechanisms
* Experience developing hosted client server applications (3+ years)
* Experience consuming services with an emphasis on REST services and message based architecture
* Strong object oriented design skills and producing well-engineered design
* Ability to quickly debug complex issues with a variety of system debugging tools
* Ability to grasp difficult concepts, large architectures, and sophisticated designs quickly
* Experience with configuration management
* Proven track record successfully being a member of an agile development team
* Strong knowledge retention capabilities
* Extremely strong written and verbal communication skills
* Teamwork and the ability to interact and communicate successfully with business partners, technology team, offshore staff, and professional services.
* Strong innovation, creativity, and problem-solving skills
* Strong estimation skills providing accurate estimates with defined risks and planned mitigations
* Ability to effectively participate in technical discussions and work toward solutions to achieve business needs
* Ability to multi-task, context switch, and succeed in a fast paced, dynamic environment

title: Instructional Designer (IDS / Web)
description:
Instructional Designer (IDS / Web) - CTP - Orlando, FL - $50.00-$60.00/hr 
The end client is unable to sponsor or transfer visas for this position; all parties authorized to work in the US without sponsorship are encouraged to apply.
Seeking an Instructional Designer (IDS / Web) in Orlando, FL. 
Role Description
The Instructional Designer III is responsible for leading a team in the design of blended learning materials for a variety of delivery methods, including instructor-led, computer-based, web-based, and mobile training.
* Lead a team in the design of blended learning materials that include sound instructional design methodology, appropriate training strategies, and participant activities for small and large groups.
* Lead the development of engaging training materials for a variety of delivery methods, including instructor-led, computer-based, web-based, and mobile training.
* Under the direction of the Project/Program Manager, provide daily supervision to ensure project goals and budgets are being met.
* Assist Project Manager in recruiting and hiring staff for project when internal resources are not sufficient.
* Research and identify data sources for instructional material development and additional information needed for instructor and participant materials.
* Develop evaluation tools for the assessment of training needs and products.
* Direct efforts of project team, coach team members, provide frequent feedback on performance.
* Train team members in Instructional Systems Design (ISD) methodology.
* Develop solutions to complex problems through the use of ingenuity and innovation.
* Perform work without appreciable direction.
* Scale design efforts to meet production timelines and budget.
* Direct the production of media.
* Work with Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) to acquire supporting materials.
* Keep abreast of training and development research: learning theory, motivation theory, and new materials, methods, and techniques.
Skills & Requirements
* Bachelor's Degree in Instructional Design, Education-related Discipline or I/O Psychology with 12+ years of direct ISD experience or MA/MS in Instructional Design, Education-related Discipline or I/O Psychology and 10+ years of direct ISD experience. The degree may be waived if equivalent, extensive related experience and/or certification can be demonstrated.
* Functional experience with authoring software is Required, such as Evolution, Impression, Captivate, Dreamweaver, etc.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Word 
* Experience working with Military personnel 
* Experience using established methodologies in all stages of the instructional design process, including needs assessment, analysis, design, development, implementation, and evaluation (i.e., ADDIE Model)
* Experience developing courseware outlines, storyboards, graphic requests, onscreen lessons, instructor guides, trainee guides, test questions, and assessments 
* Superior time management and organizational skills 
* Strong written and presentation skills
* Strong quality assurance/editing skills 
* An active or active within the last 24 months Secret Security Clearance is Strongly Preferred

title: Remote Senior Full-Stack Web Engineer - Angular9, Redux, APIs
description:
If you are a Remote Senior Full-Stack Web Engineer with experience, please read on!

As a Remote Senior Full-Stack Web Engineer, you will be primarily working on our Inform and Connect Products, which are critical components that enable university administrators to configure, manage, and obtain insights from our core platform. You will help lead a team of talented and highly collaborative engineers to ensure that the web-based product is scalable, maintainable, a delight to use, and provides the most value to our customers.



We are looking for individuals who share our values, who will:



- Put Student Success First: Ready Education exists to improve student success. As a an engineer on the team, you will work to ensure that our product is successfully adopted and utilized by our 300+ campuses, and with every decision, always put the student at the heart



- Accomplish More As a Team: our team here at Ready is made up of passionate, hardworking people who support, care for, and challenge each other to achieve wins together. We learn from each other and embrace creative tension to ensure the best idea wins. We collaborate to solve problems together



- Have a Learning Mentality: we are looking for intellectually curious people who never stop learning and growing and who embrace change, which is essential at a constantly evolving tech company. You will continuously push yourself and others around you to improve and evolve



- Move Fast and Innovate: to be successful at Ready, you will need to be self-motivated and able to work autonomously. You will need to have excellent judgement and decision making skills to solve problems and move forward quickly
- Work on our web-based administrator app that helps universities manage our mobile platform built in Angular 9
- Help lead the team of engineers to craft high-quality software with predictable, healthy agile processes

- Work with the Product Manager on the squad to ensure productive, fast-moving sprints that deliver the maximum value to our customers

- Work with the Design team to ensure that our web product is user friendly and highly polished

- Help improve our web technology architecture and ensure the reliability and flexibility of our stack as we scale

- Work on the backend platform components that power the web application (Python-based REST API)

- Help to continuously improve the team processes of our engineering team
You should:

- Have at least 7 years experience with frontend and web development, with prior experience as a Team Lead

- Have extensive experience with Angular v9+ based web applications and the angular ecosystem, CLI, Nx, schematics.

- Have experience with NgRx or other Redux like state management library

- Have experience working with async code and libraries like RxJS

- Have extensive experience building and maintaining business-critical web applications at scale, including the build and deployment process

- Have experience worked with and led a remote or distributed team

- Have extensive experience working with various APIs (e.g. REST)

- Have experience implementing API backends based on Python or similar languages

- Have experience working with Git-based version control, and within a pull/merge request based collaboration process

- Have good writing and verbal communication skills, with experience working in a remote or distributed team environment



Nice to haves:

- Experience with other JS frameworks

- Experience working with AWS cloud services

- Experience working with Ansible or related DevOps tools



You should include in your application:

- Why you want to work this role at Ready Education
- Fully Remote

title: Full Stack JavaScript Engineer
description:
We are fast-paced banking startup in the Los Angeles area looking to give underserved markets a better banking solution.  In less than a few months, we have already secured over $3M in Seed money from the same investors behind some of the hottest startups ( companies like Bitium, Mover, MapSense, Oculus, and many more!).  Our executive and founding team comes from a solid mix of fast-paced startups such as Honey (recently acquired by PayPal for $4B), Happy Money, and Aspiration Investments, and brings a diverse background of experience and leadership as we continue to expand our innovative banking platform.

Our platform is gaining popularity without any need for advertising, and we have an active waitlist of over 40,000 new users looking to gain access.  We are in need of a Lead Software Engineer to work hands on building out highly scaled back end services to support our rapidly growing customer base.  We are looking for someone who has built up a similar software product from scratch. We are open to the latest in open-source technologies and frameworks (Java, Golang, Node.JS, etc), and we are looking for a Full Stack JavaScript Engineer to take an active role in shaping the direction of our architecture.
- Write well designed, testable, efficient code
- Create efficient architectural and REST API integrations

- Evaluate and deploy software tools, processes and metrics

- Help improve on scalability of micro services architecture

- Create amazing things that scale
The Full Stack JavaScript Engineer must have at least 1-3  years of experience and be familiar with:

- Solid grasp of JavaScript development on front and back end features

- Understanding of full stack development with React.JS and Node.JS architecture

- Experience building highly scaled platforms in modern cloud architecture

- Creating custom REST APIs and integrating them into back end features

- BS or MS degree in Computer Science preferred



Nice to Have:



- Experience building distributed systems

- Solid grasp of micro services architecture

- Background in consumer facing or advertising technology
- We pay 100% of medical, dental, and vision premiums for full-time employees and their dependents
- Fast moving environment with ability to impact corporate strategy

- Open vacation policy; we dont count days
So, if you are a Full Stack JavaScript Engineer looking to work with highly scaled and massively distributed back end services, we want to see your resume today!
CyberCoders will consider for Employment in the City of Los Angeles qualified Applicants with Criminal Histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring (Ban the Box) Ordinance.

title: Remote Senior PHP Developer - Laravel, PostgreSQL, AWS, Docker
description:
If you are a Remote Senior PHP Developer with experience, please read on!

We are a Machine Learning software based start-up company built to apply our novel AI technology to the Agricultural Industry. Our mission is to optimize the costs of supplying the worlds food requirements while optimizing the profits for farmers. Our models precisely predict what type and amounts of nutrients are needed to best satisfy soil and environmental characteristics for different types of genetic hybrid seeds. We are looking for a senior software developer to lead our team on the development and deployment of our AWS cloud based application platform.



The role requires hands on leadership necessary to grow a team through the startup phase into a mature organization with responsibility for building and scaling a new Agriculture analytics platform as well as maintaining existing data functions primarily based on cloud-based SaaS systems.
1. Paid time off
2. Work from home 

3. Flexible schedule

4. Relocation assistance if open to relocating to Utah
- Code development for our back-end application platform using AWS scalable cloud-based technologies and framework for our next generation Machine Learning analytics platform.

- Design and implementing of PostgreSQL and geo-spatial extensions including database schema optimization preferably using the Django or Flask application Frameworks.



- Definition and implementation of platform requirements, interfaces and code-module flows based on customer and market requirements.



- Developing our application products, software requirements and specifications while continuously analyzing processes for improved performance, adaptability and scalability.



- Developing test harness and associated scripts to properly conduct automated platform testing and bug identification.



- Creating common ETL software in a highly pipelined environment allowing our data-scientists to pre-process customer data into multi-dimensional ML training covariates.



- Cultivating and leading the Company's development team and communicating with customer support and management team.
- Minimum of Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Computer Engineering and Information Systems, or another quantitative discipline field or equivalent of work experience.

- 10+ years of hands-on experience with software development and data engineering programming including relational and geospatial databases, multi-dimensional data feature sets, cloud based data warehouses, analytic platform development, software tools, and integration tools and related programming languages.



- Proficiency with PHP, Python, Database management and state of the art frameworks and AWS or cloud DevOps is required.



- Experience with building high performing and scalable SaaS platforms using Docker, Kubernetes, and persistence technologies like PostgreSQL/PostGIS, AWS ElasticSearch and S3 in the cloud.



- Experience with front end UI/UX JavaScript frameworks including browser scripting frameworks and debuggers is a plus.



- Experience coding REST APIs, communication services and ETL of big-data at scale to process and transform 100-million transactions and data points on any given day is also a plus.
- So, if you are a Senior PHP Developer with experience, please apply today!

title: Multimedia Manager
description:
Marketing
Multimedia Manager
 
Exempt
         
Director of Marketing and Communications
The role of the Multimedia Manager is to create visually engaging and informative marketing materials that successfully engage and inform the intended target audiences. The multimedia designer will be responsible for concept and creation of layouts for print, website, social media, presentations, motion graphics and video. Other scheduled tasks include ongoing collaboration with the other marketing team members as well as PA Cyber interdepartmental collaboration efforts.
· Bachelor’s Degree in multimedia or graphic design or related field
· Master’s Degree in marketing or related field preferred
· Design firm or advertising agency work experience preferred
· Diploma or certified courses in design, film, social media, communications, etc. will also prove to be beneficial for this position
· Minimum of seven years’ design development work experience including hands on content creation and implementation in all of the following areas: print design, web design, video development (including hands-on shooting and editing skills), social media content creation, PowerPoint presentation development and photography experience
· Proficient in Microsoft Office suite
· Innovative, creatively confident and collaborative
· Results-oriented, design thinking methodology (empathize, define, ideate, prototype, test)
· Flexible multi-tasker who also possesses an organized and timely deadline-driven work ethic
· Proficiency in a broad scope of multimedia applications, strong technical skills, and the ability to conceptualize with internal clients to produce powerful creative
· Advanced proficiency using the Adobe Creative Suite products including InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator, Acrobat, After Effects and Premier – knowledge of Dreamweaver is a plus
· Familiarity with the creation of click generating web ads, social media postings and general email marketing campaigns
· Excellent verbal and written communications skills
· Child Abuse Clearance; Pennsylvania State Police Criminal Record Check; Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) Clearance
:
· Utilize modern graphic design styles, to strategize, plan and create key artistic branded elements in promotion of PA Cyber throughout all available marketing and communication channels.
· Create both static and motion visuals
· Design and present visual storytelling through infographics
· Design for video output
· Create wireframes, storyboards, and prototypes for use in design review
· Conduct general user testing
· Maintain and manage PA Cyber content and multimedia assets
· Work with professional service vendors as needed or requested
· Manage projects and meet deadlines as required
· Assist in marketing presentations as requested
· Work under pressure, meet deadlines, handle a variety of tasks simultaneously
· Attend meetings as requested
· Travel as required, must be able to travel
· Work extended hours as needed or requested
· Perform any additional duties deemed necessary to meet the ongoing needs of the organization by the Director of Marketing and Communications
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally required to stand, walk, sit; use hands to handle or feel objects, tools or controls; reach with hands and arms; climb stairs; balance; stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by the job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and the ability to adjust focus.

title: Veterinary Technician - 001269
description:
Banfield aspires to be a practice where as a team, we make a positive impact on pet health care in hospitals, communities, and the field of veterinary medicine. And, we believe hiring people with diverse perspectives, ideas, and cultures, permits us to deliver to the highest quality of preventive care.
As a Banfield veterinary technician, you will work alongside pet health care industry experts to make a difference in the lives of the pets and clients we serve. With the chance to utilize your veterinary knowledge, communication skills, and love for pets, this role will afford you the opportunity to define a clear career path for continued growth and learning.
Veterinary Technician Certification or Licensure (CVT, RVT, LVT, or LVMT)
Being a veterinary technician requires much more than AVMA certified credentials. It means bringing your talents, skills, dedication, and a desire for developing alongside your peers. But, most importantly, it means showing up each day with a passion for pets and working with others who believe preventive care is the key to helping pets achieve long and healthy lives.
As we do with all our associates, we look to our vet techs to adopt our Five Principles — Quality, Responsibility, Mutuality, Efficiency and Freedom. And, while your on-paper qualifications are of course important, we actively seek out vet techs who thrive on delivering outstanding client and pet experiences.
We know that your real passion for pet well-being is why you chose this profession. At Banfield, we believe it is just as important to support the well-being of those who devote their lives to this cause. Through our extensive network and support structure, Banfield offers a wide array of benefits and programs, empowering you to focus on yourself and your family, as you care for pets and clients
As a Banfield vet tech, we want you to take full advantage of work and play through:
Whether you are a newly certified or an experienced vet tech, a job at Banfield opens the door to exploring the next best move in your career. We are committed to helping you grow as a vet tech by providing:
We’ve created a structure that includes leadership and support at the hospital level, in the field, and at our headquarters, all with one goal in mind: helping you deliver quality care for all pets.
Through volunteering efforts, and our programs designed to benefit local shelters and rescues, we strengthen the pet-human connections in our communities. Discover how we support the wellbeing of our people and profession through the Mars Volunteer Program (MVP).
Banfield Pet Hospital® strongly supports and values the uniqueness of all individuals and promotes a work environment where diversity is embraced. Banfield Pet Hospital is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, genetic information, or protected veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know. Banfield Pet Hospital follows all applicable federal, state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every Banfield location.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
We’re America’s largest mortgage lender, closing loans in all 50 states. J.D. Power ranked Quicken Loans “Highest in Customer Satisfaction in Primary Mortgage Origination” for the past nine consecutive years, 2010 – 2018. The company was also ranked highest in the nation for client satisfaction among mortgage servicers by J.D. Power for five consecutive years, 2014 through 2018, each year the company was eligible. There’s a simple reason we’ve been so successful: We care about the people we work with.
If you’re tired of stuffy, bureaucratic workplaces, then you’ll be delighted to find something different here. We strive to make a creative, fun and collaborative environment you simply won’t find anywhere else. Quicken Loans was named #1 in ESSENCE Magazine’s first ever list of “Best Places to Work for African Americans” in 2015. We've been on Computerworld's "Best Places to Work in IT" list for 13 years running, hitting #1 the last five years. We were also ranked #14 in FORTUNE Magazine’s list of "100 Best Companies to Work For" in 2018, remaining in the top-30 for the past 15 years.
The Senior Software Engineer mentors Associate Software Engineers, leads small development teams and acts as an application owner, in addition to developing, improving and maintaining innovative software applications as part of a team or independently. This team member takes a lead role in design and code reviews, assists with delivery estimates and provides feedback about all aspects of the process – all while working with a variety of team members across the entire organization.

title: Senior Mobile Automation QA Tester
description:
Job title: Senior Mobile Automation QA Tester.
location: Los Angeles, CA
This is a 6-12 months extendable contract in Los Angeles, CA
Due to the Coronavirus epidemic, position will start as REMOTE (work from Home) till epidemic is over
 
SKILLS & EXPERIENCE REQUIRED
 
* 3+ years of hands-on experience using mobile testing frameworks such as XCode, XCTest, XCUITest, Appium, Android Studio
* Experience with API automation testing tools - Selenium, HP UFT/QTP, SOAP UI, Postman.
* Design, develop and maintain UI Automation Scripts in C#/SpecFlow/Cucumber.
* Experience on load testing using JMeter/VSLoadTest/BlazeMeter.
* Basic coding and debugging skills on Microsoft dot net/C#/java/Javascript code using visual studio/vs code.
* Experience working with continuous integration tools. (TFS, Jenkins, Bamboo, etc.)
* Translate functional requirements, use cases into clear, concise, detail-oriented test plans/cases
* Experience working in an agile environment and knowledge of Scrum/SAFe methodologies
* Docker & Azure Cloud experience
* Experience with Designing and building automation frameworks for Mobile/Web applications developed in React Native/React JS
* Experience with Creating automated integration cases for native mobile device applications / iOS and Android mobile platforms.
* Experience with maintaining and writing automated test cases, as well as create automation frameworks. The creation of test cases are based on user stories.
* Experience with creating reports, test the app from a design and usability perspective, and support testing throughout the life cycle of the product.
* MUST be willing to communicate efficiently and effectively and always be ready to support their peers.
* Create and maintain test plans for new and existing features of Mobile/Web applications developed in React Native/React JS
* Ability to work across multiple technologies, our frontend (React/Redux site, React-Native app), as well as our backend (node.js) and database (MongoDB).
* Review features in development and can identify incomplete specifications or prospective testing risks
* Maintain and Execute automated test scripts, as well as create automation frameworks
* Keep all stakeholders updated on the status of testing and communicate any blockers or delays when testing through reporting and metrics

title: 3D Motion Designer
description:
Solize USA Corporation is an engineering services company providing a comprehensive spread of services in CAD/CAE/CFD to leading Automotive industries worldwide.
Solize is currently looking for an experienced 3D Motion Designer for an Auto OEM.
Our team is responsible for creating user interfaces and apps for the next generation of vehicles, as well as concepts for future human-machine interfaces on mobility platforms. The candidate would join a team of UX Designers, UI Designers, Researchers, Storytellers, and Programmers to create 3D Motion Design. The candidate will also work with engineers, researchers, and designers from other departments throughout the organization to support the development of future product concepts.
The ideal candidate must have a strong passion and ability to be creative both within and without parameters, be able to create inspiring 2D and 3D motion graphics, and exhibit deep attention to detail and passion for simplifying user experiences.
• 3-5 years of motion graphic design, 3D design, interaction design, animation, or similar UI-related experience.
• Intermediate to the expert level in 3D/motion tools such as AfterEffects, Trapcode Suite, Cinema4D, Motion, and Maya.
• Ability to manipulate pre-made 3D assets including setting up animations, texture mapping, lighting, keyframes, and motion paths.
• Intermediate to expert level proficiency in UX/UI software including Axure, Sketch, and Adobe Suite.
• A portfolio of work demonstrating relevant experience that shows independently produced original samples.
• BA/BS in Design
• Experience working in a team environment and directly with developers for implementation of designs.
• Familiarity with user interface patterns for web/mobile/consumer electronics
• Prior experience working with Industrial Designers
• Strong time management skills and the ability to be self-directed when needed
• Solid written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present a strong rationale for design decisions
• Ability to prototype in HTML, JavaScript, & CSS is a plus
• Expertise with design, creation, and specification of UI Movement/Motion design (behaviors, transitions, easing).

The NetSuite Developer/Administrator is also responsible to define, develop, test, analyze, maintain, and improvement of in-house and vendor provided software applications. The Developer will also research, design, document, and modify software specifications throughout the systems development life cycle.

title: Clinical Documentation Specialist - Coder
description:
The Clinical Documentation Specialist will audit medical records to ensure completeness, accuracy, and compliance with Medicare coding and supporting documentation guidelines: specifically, the International Classification of Diseases Manual – Clinical Modification (ICD-10-CM). The Clinical Documentation Specialist will educate and advise Interdisciplinary Team (IDT) in the Medicare documentation guidelines, as well as specific and accurate coding techniques.  The Clinical Documentation Specialist will be responsible for providing reports on clinical coding and documentation trends to providers and managers.  This position is full time.  Monday thru Friday, 8am to 4pm.
 
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:
 
Evaluates medical record documentation for completion to ensure accuracy and compliance to meet CMS standards.
Serves as a resource for Element Care sites to address risk adjustment and medical coding guidelines and updates.
Work with IDT in regards to NextGen EHR.
Other responsibilities as required.
EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS:

title: In House Art Designer
description: At Lundbeck, we are tirelessly dedicated to restoring brain health so every person can be their best. Headquartered in Copenhagen with a U.S. home office in Deerfield, Ill., Lundbeck is the only global biopharmaceutical company focused solely on brain diseases. Our legacy in neuroscience goes back seven decades and we have a long heritage of innovation. Lundbeck has developed and commercialized some of the world’s most widely prescribed therapies for psychiatric and neurological disorders. Today, we remain uncompromisingly committed to improving the quality of life for people impacted by brain disorders. Lundbeck is unique from other biopharmaceutical companies in that we are 70 percent owned by a research-focused foundation. We have a deep and productive pipeline, and we continue to bring forward symptomatic therapies to help people live better lives, while simultaneously pursuing disease-modifying treatments.

title: Principal IT Security Architect
description:
Requisition ID:  58943  
Job Function/Category:  Information Technology  
Employment Type:  Exempt Full Time  
 This position is responsible for formalizing the design & implementation of a robust information security architecture for Corporate IT, Operational Technology (OT), and Internet of Things (IoT) enabled systems. He/She will develop automated security and compliance capabilities in support of DevOps processes in an enterprise AWS cloud computing environment. He/she will be responsible for assisting the CISO in developing, managing, and implementing the IT and OT cybersecurity strategy and roadmap. IT Security Risk and Compliance (ITSRC) org requires dedicated resources in security architecture function to ensure secure delivery of cloud initiatives, devsecops and Energy Strong Program.
-Lead and manage the development of Information Security Architecture, standards and design patterns
 -Leverage DevOps tools to build, harden, maintain and instrument a comprehensive cloud-based security orchestration platform to be consumed in product CI/CD pipelines.
 -Participate in and reviews risk assessments to ensure compliance with Security Architecture objectives and standards.
 -Design and implement Cloud-native architectures that will allow business requirements to be met with a minimal degree of risk to the organization
 -Design and implement security controls for Advanced Metering Infrastructure (AMI) and Customer Systems.
Required Skills:
Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related discipline.
 • At least 10 years of experience in cybersecurity field.
 • Minimum five years of experience in Security architecture function.
 • Proficiency in at least one scripting language
 • Experience in Advanced Metering Infrastructure (AMI), Meter Data Management (MDM or MDMS), Load Control, Demand Response, Smart Grid would be preferred
 • Strong leadership and influence skills
 • Ability to present to all levels of management & executive leadership
 • Excellent teamwork, facilitation, relationship building, and negotiation skills
 • Able to maintain positive working relationships both leading and as part of a team;
 • Effective time management skills and able to multitask effectively;
 • Able to communicate effectively with both technical and non-technical individuals;
 • Defines strategy and architecture for security solutions that protect company infrastructure and data, while incorporating applicable compliance standards.
 • Reviews new, and changes to existing, applications and infrastructure for security risk. Provides expert advice using existing and new security technologies to reduce risk and support implementation of new products and features needed by business.
 • Reviews/validates application configurations and code for security risks.
 • Understands threats to data and how to use encryption, access control, DRM, DLP, and other technologies to reduce risk.
 • Experienced in multiple platforms, including Windows, Unix, Network, Cloud, and End User/Mobile devices.
 • Experience with Identity and Access Management.
 • Reviews network architecture diagrams for various attack vectors and provides expert advice on mitigating threats via proper architecture design.
 • Focuses on cloud-based solutions that work in an existing hybrid cloud/on premise environment.
 • Understands and is capable of working within DevOps model, embracing guardrail model of security to support rapid development in an Agile framework.
 • NERC CIP position, requires NERC CIP background investigation prior to start security threats
Desired Skills:
Experience with the implementation of NIST Cyber Security Framework (CSF), North American Electric Reliability Corporation Critical Infrastructure Protection (NERC CIP) and Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC) Nuclear Cyber (10 CFR 73.54)
Information Technology/Operational Technologies experience in Energy Management System (EMS), Advanced Distribution Management System (ADMS), Grid Intelligence & Security (GIS), Outage Management System (OMS), and Supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA)
Previous experience of IT/OT technologies and utility industry experience preferred with an awareness of utility specific security threats.As an employee of PSE&G or PSEG Long Island, you should be aware that during storm restoration efforts, you may be required to perform functions outside of your routine duties and on a schedule that may be different from normal operations. 
This site ( http://www.pseg.com ) is strictly for candidates who are not currently PSEG employees. PSEG employees must apply for jobs internally through empower which can be accessed through the mypseg homepage by clicking on the employee center tab, then under the empower header, choose careers. 
Business needs may cause PSEG to cancel or delay filling position at any time during the selection process. 
Certain positions at the Company may require you to have access to Part 810-Controlled Information.  Under the law, the Company is limited in who it can share this information with and in certain circumstances it is necessary to obtain specific authorization before the Company can share this information.  Accordingly, if the position does require access to this information, you must complete a 10 CFR Part 810 Export Control Compliance Nationality Request Form, a copy of which will be provided to you by Talent Acquisition if an offer is made.  If there is a need for specific authorization, due to the time it takes to obtain authorization from the government, we will likely not be able to further proceed with an offer.

title: Principal Full-Stack Software Engineer
description:
More than 30 years ago, E*TRADE pioneered the online brokerage industry by executing the first-ever electronic individual investor trade. While the landscape of our industry has changed dramatically, our culture of innovation and drive to make online trading accessible to everyone continues to drive us forward. We believe in challenging the status quo, fostering an environment of curiosity and learning, and, above all, putting our customers first.
E*TRADE Corporate Services is the leader in providing equity compensation products for public and private companies. We provide robust applications by using the best technologies, following solid design principles. Our work culture fosters an incredible exposure to innovative ideas and challenges that create experience and opportunity. We are looking for highly motivated individuals who are ready to learn and grow. As a Principal Software Engineer, you will play a critical role in design and development of software applications used by E*TRADE's clients, customer and support personnel. This role requires strong software engineering, design and development skills, and good problem solving skills.
 
 
REQUIREMENTS
 
 
We offer a competitive and comprehensive benefits package. Please visit https://www.etradecareers.com/why-work-at-etrade/employee-benefits/ to learn more about the opportunities.

title: Clinical Documentation Specialist Case Management FT/40HRS
description:
The clinical documentation specialist collaborates extensively with physicians, nursing staff, other patient caregivers and coding staff to improve the quality and completeness of documentation of care provided and coded for coordination, abstraction, and submission of accurate data required by CMS. Facilitates concurrent modifications to clinical documentation to insure commensurate reimbursement of clinical severity and services rendered to patients with a DRG based payer (Medicare, Medicaid). Supports timely, accurate and complete documentation of clinical information used for measuring and reporting physician and facility outcomes. Communicates with and educates all clinical staff concerning accurate and effective clinical documentation
 
RN; Graduate of accredited school of nursing

Licensed as a Registered Nurse in the State of New Mexico. 
 
 
Minimum of 5 years recent experience in an acute care setting in a clinical nursing field required. Prior experience in clinical documentation improvement, utilization review/management, discharge planning, quality management, case management or coding preferred.
 
 
Director of Case Management Services
 
General office environment and general hospital department/nursing units.
 
Ability to walk and stand 80% of work time.

title: SharePoint Lead
description:
Savan Group is looking for a SharePoint Lead or SharePoint Power User. The candidate selected for this role will provide a wide range of support for multiple in-house, custom SharePoint tools. Tasks include providing site and content administration support by managing permissions and creating and maintaining sites, workflows, lists, and libraries. The candidate selected for this role will be responsible for assisting the Senior Developers with functional testing of custom solutions, creating process documentation, and documenting and troubleshooting technical problems with SharePoint 2013 and Online. Additional tasks could include unit and functional testing on application features and test case development. There is opportunity for significant growth and new SharePoint tool development in the next 6–12 months on this project, allowing for current skills to be solidified as well as new functionalities to be learned.
 
80% client site (Washington, DC); 20% Savan Group HQ (McLean, VA)
 May 2020
 
Submit your resume, cover letter, application, and salary requirements via our Careers Page www.savangroup.com/jobs. Applicants selected for interview will be notified by email or phone.

ECWS is in need of a System Administrator specializing in integrating existing and future applications into 0365/SharePoint.
• Domains: IT Infrastructure, system architecture design, system configuration management, system troubleshooting, and database management.

• Integrate existing ECWS applications into Office365/SharePoint.

• Location: Lexington MA, 02420

title: Executive Legal Assistant (Litigation)
description:
The Washington, DC office of PilieroMazza PLLC has an opening for an Executive Legal Assistant with experience to support several attorneys across our four practice groups: Government Contracting, Labor & Employment, Business & Corporate, and Litigation & Dispute Resolution. Qualified candidates must have a proven work ethic, excellent communication and organizational skills, and substantive experience supporting attorneys in litigation matters, including assembly of pleadings and motions, general filing procedures for state and federal courts and local agencies, and compilation and preparation of exhibits. Successful candidates will be proficient in multi-tasking while prioritizing competing demands. Only individuals with three or more years of legal assistant experience and a college degree will be considered.
In addition to the duties listed above, this position also entails many administrative functions which include scheduling, proofing and formatting documents, inputting changes, preparing exhibits, maintaining attorney calendars, communicating with clients and other outside sources, occasional answering of telephones, transcription, billable time entry, and revising PowerPoint presentations. Legal Assistants also provide overflow assistance to other Assistants in the firm. It is critical that Assistants have strong computer skills and be extremely detail-oriented. Applicants should be proficient in the Microsoft Office programs, including Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook, as well as Adobe Acrobat (PDF). It is a requirement of the position that candidates possess advanced proficiency in Microsoft Word, including the ability to effectively use styles, cross referencing, auto-numbering, etc. Experience or familiarity with conflicts checks and setting up new clients and matters is a plus. Send resume to recruiting@pilieromazza.com.

title: Senior Accountant
description:
The National Environmental Health Association (NEHA) is currently seeking a Senior Accountant to join our team in Denver, CO. 

NEHA' s mission is to advance the environmental health professional for the purpose of providing a healthful environment for all. Be part of an organization that supports thousands of members committed to ensuring that the air we breathe, food we eat, water we drink and play in, and the homes and buildings we live and work in are all safe to enjoy. Since 1937 NEHA has been at the crossroads wherever human health and the environment intersect. As a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization, through grant and membership support, NEHA works with federal partners such as the EPA, CDC and FDA on critical and diverse issues such as climate change, food safety, water quality, preparedness and more. 

About the Role 
The Senior Accountant manages the day-to-day financial accounting, budgeting, and reporting related to NEHA memberships, grants, and contracts. Daily tasks involve confirming bank balances and recording transactions. Monthly duties include preparing all entries and items noted on the close checklist, including journal entries, reconciliations, and updating grant spreadsheets. The Senior Accountant will also review bank reconciliations, accounts receivable, accounts payable, and payroll. The Senior Accountant must make decisions quickly under pressure, assume independent responsibility, possess high energy and creativity, and use sound judgment.

What You Will Do

	* Record accounting transactions in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP)
	* Coordinate the month-end and year-end close processes
	* Review semi-monthly payroll and payroll journal entry
	* Prepare and review journal entries, cash receipts, and bank reconciliations
	* Prepare monthly financial statements for review by Accounting Manager in a timely manner
	* Maintain accurate grant budgets and financial reports
	* Assist with preparation of grant budgets for proposals
	* Maintain compliance with federal grant management requirements (OMB Uniform Guidance)
	* Assist with development of annual budget
	* Assist with annual audit, preparation of Form 990, and benefit plan return
	* Provide excellent customer service to members and employees

Physical Requirements 

	* Ability to occasionally lift 25 lbs. or less
	* Ability to sit and stand for extended periods of time
	* Manual dexterity required for operating office equipment
	* Ability to read required reports and computer screen
	* Hearing required to interact with management and associates 

Our Ideal Candidate 
Education and experience: 

	* Bachelor’s degree in Accounting
	* At least three years’ experience as an accountant in a non-profit setting
	* Basic knowledge of grant, contract, and project management principles

Skills, abilities, and character: 

	* Ability to communicate financial data to all levels of organization staff
	* Accuracy and attention to detail
	* Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines
	* Organizational and time management skills
	* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
	* Proficient in Microsoft Office and Adobe Acrobat

Preferred Experience and Skills

	* Experience using MemberSuite or similar Customer Relationship Management or Association Management Software
	* Experience using Microsoft Dynamics GP

What We Offer 

	* The salary for this position is $60,000-65,000 dependent on experience and qualifications. 
	* We offer a generous benefits package including paid time off and health, dental, and vision plans with employee premiums paid 100% by the association. Our benefits also include a five percent of base salary employer contribution to 403b retirement plan; paid short and long-term disability plans and paid term life insurance. We offer workplace flexibility including telework and a wellness program led by an employee committee that strives to inspire, create and maintain a workplace environment that supports physical, mental, and social well-being. 

When Considering Applicants
When considering applicants, we look for integrity, a vision for what is possible and a proven performance record, along with the education, experience and skills that match the position requirements. 

Equal Opportunity Employer (EOE)
