title: Accounts Payable Coordinator
description:
Accounts Payable Coordinator 

	Bassi Edlin Huie & Blum (BEHB) is currently seeking an Accounts Payable Coordinator to join their team in San Francisco, CA 94111. 

	Who we are:
	* Bassi Edlin Huie & Blum is a defense firm of trial specialists offering the unique blend of large-firm experience and small-firm agility.  From our offices in San Francisco and Los Angeles, we help clients confront and overcome a wide variety of complex claims in state and federal court throughout California.  We are adept at handling high-stakes environmental cases involving cutting-edge legal precedent, as well as advanced scientific and engineering concepts. 
	* Our attorneys take effective depositions, produce winning law & motion work, and use the   latest technology to gain an edge in complex litigation.  To prepare for trial, we work with the right experts to develop strong defense strategies and employ talented artists to craft compelling visual exhibits.  [1] https://www.behblaw.com/ 

	The San Francisco, California office of Bassi Edlin Huie & Blum is currently accepting resumes for an Accounts Payable Coordinator. The Accounts Payable Coordinator works with the Accounting Department and contributes to the management and profitability of the firm through accurate verification, reconciliation, analysis, and processing of all payables. The A/P Coordinator works closely with the Controller.

	Goals of the Position:
	* Ensure correct invoice processing
	* Further enhance the A/P procedures by gaining efficiencies where able and improving accuracy through process improvement
	* Accurate and timely posting of payables and checks
	* Control expenses through analysis and verification of invoices and expense reports
	* Protect clients by keeping information confidential
	* Maintain strong vendor relationships through effective communication.

	About the Role:
	* Review, organize, and prioritize vendor invoices
	* Code, process, and scan (pdf) client related vendor invoices ensuring accuracy and necessary approvals from attorneys, paralegals, and secretaries
	* Attached scanned copies of vendor invoices to billing statements
	* Code and process non-client related vendor invoices
	* Review, code, and process checks, wires, ACH payments, and credit card payments
	* Review vendor statements monthly
	* Monitor accounts to ensure payments are up to date
	* Process credit memos/request refunds, when applicable
	* Monitor manual logs (Air table) to ensure processing of invoices
	* Resolve invoice discrepancies
	* Vendor setup and maintenance
	* Correspond with vendors and respond to inquiries
	* Produce monthly reports
	* Process 1099s and reporting
	* Process recurring payments
	* Vendor file maintenance
	* Comply with relevant internal controls, policies and procedures
	* Monitor and analyze specific AP operations, such as invoice research and follow-up, problem documentation, and standardization of input
	* Assist accounting team from time to time

	Our ideal candidate:

	Education and Experience
	* 2-5+ years of relevant experience in A/P
	* Bachelor’s or Associate accounting or business-related degree and/or sufficient related work Experience
	* Strong knowledge of Accounts Payable principles and processes
	* Knowledge and use of Air table is highly desirable
	* Basic knowledge and understanding of General Accounting Principles
	* Basic knowledge of business principles and processes
	* Microsoft Operating System and Office Applications, including strong Excel skills
	* Business Accounting software experience; Prolaw highly desirable
	* Ability to work independently and as part of a team
	* Self-motivated and pro-active
	* Highly effective and persuasive communication skills
	* Vendor relations management
	* Filing and document management
	* Proficient and accurate ten-key and keyboard data entry
	* Attention to detail, time-management, prioritization, and organization skills
	* Strong Arithmetic skill set

	Physical Requirements:
	* Stand, walk, bend, and sit at a desk
	* Lift up to 25lbs
	* Ability to type and operate standard office equipment, daily

	What we offer:
	* Compensation including annual salary based upon relevant experience and education
	* Comprehensive benefits package (Medical, Dental, Vision, FSA, Sections 125 & 132, 401k)
	* Paid Vacation, PTO and Sick time
	* Discretionary Bonus
	* Basic Life Insurance

	To Apply: 
 Please submit your resume via the "APPLY NOW" button

	Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Licensed Nursing Home Administrator
description:
The NewCourtland Senior Services (NCSS) Network carries out its healing mission for Philadelphia’s seniors by meeting their individual and changing needs. We also understand the unique challenge of nursing home care due to budget constraints, overworked staff, and a parent company that only cares about numbers.
At NCSS we are defined by values, quality care for all, and uplifting people. If you are looking for a healthcare organization where you can bring your best 'YOU' to work, where you can make a difference, and where you can team-up with like-minded co-workers, then we are also looking for you. Join us!
Position Summary: Part of the NCSS Network, Germantown Home, a 180-bed beautiful, skilled nursing facility located in Mount Airy, PA has an opportunity for an exceptional Licensed Nursing Home Administrator (LNHA) who is passionate about providing quality care to our healthcare residents and leadership to all staff.
The LNHA holding the highest-level position in the facility and reports to the Vice President, Healthcare Services will have the responsibility for the overall census of the facility and as well as the efficient and profitable operation of the facility, to ensure that the facility remains in compliance with policies and procedures, State and Federal rules and regulations, retention and financial performance.
The preferred candidate will have previously worked as and is a Registered Nurse. We believe this background will aid in managing facility employees in the provision of care and services rendered in accord with professional standards, and in compliance with state and federal laws and regulations, collaborating with consultants, contractors, referring physicians, community resources, government agencies and advocacy groups.

title: Real Estate Appraiser
description:
Not all appraisers want to be a business owner... as an independent appraiser, you are responsible for everything from bookkeeping to taking out the trash. When I was independent I realized I was spending 30 to 40% of my time managing day to day operations; marketing, paying bills, tracking down receivables, preparing tax information, paying taxes, setting up my orders, responding to endless update and revision requests, bidding orders and more. At Marketwise Appraisal, we focus on letting the appraiser just appraise real estate. Our support staff manages all the day to day operations, assists in report set up, acts as a firewall between you and the client so you can get work done!
Our employees are W2 income, have a comprehensive health insurance program where we pay 75% of the cost as well as Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, High speed company laptop, work from home or at our centrally located office using our state of the art cloud system of virtual computers and server. Work from anywhere with a decent internet connection just like you were in the office. We also pay for E&O, MLS subscriptions and board dues, Alamode Total, Spark (data importer), Anow (appraisal tracking software and scheduler) All of your reports will have the client data, subject data and maps pre loaded and waiting on the server. Our staff averages over 20 years experience and are always glad to help!
***Key Requirements***
*Minimum of Certified Residential Appraiser License in the State of Arizona, or be willing to relocate and reciprocate (Will train for geographic competence)
*Newly certified and seasoned appraisers are welcome
*FHA roster required (You can get on the roster after hire)
*Ability to complete 25 to 35+ orders a month 
*Willing to accept complex assignments (help available if needed)
*Reliable/presentable transportation and auto insurance
*Professional Appearance/attire (business causal, shorts and jeans are okay as long as presentable)
*Good computer skills (not a programmer but proficient in MS Office (Outlook, excel, word etc), Windows 10 Pro, Adobe Acrobat, Appraisal software (We use Alamode Total)
Job Purpose:
Estimates property value by providing appraisals and consultations; researching and analyzing property information; reconciling various indicators; preparing an appraisal report.
Duties:
* Identifies value to be estimated by studying appraisal request, problem to be solved, and scope of the project, such as, mortgage financing, insurance replacement cost calculation, estate valuation, tax appeals, equitable distribution, corporate employee relocation, investment, or sale; identifying property characteristics.
* Determines valuation method by selecting approach and techniques for valuing property, i.e., cost, direct sales comparison, and income capitalization; identifying property characteristics and attributes.
* Researches and analyzes property information by collecting, verifying, and analyzing data regarding inventory of competitive properties, sales and listings, vacancies and offerings, absorption rates, demand studies, social, economic, governmental, and environmental characteristics, restrictions, encumbrances, covenants, contracts, declarations, special assessments, ordinances, cost and depreciation, income/expense and capitalization rate, history of ownership, and use of the property; conducting analyzes and studies, e.g., land utilization, supply and demand, economic feasibility, highest and best use, marketability, development, litigation support; searching databases; inspecting property; interviewing people in a position to understand the property.
* Develops an appraisal conclusion by evaluating information; reconciling various indicators;
* Prepares appraisal report by describing physical and economic property characteristics, appraisal procedures used, and information analyzed; disclosing extraordinary assumptions, and hypothetical and limiting conditions; presenting supportive reasoning.
* Maintains organization reputation by conforming to the Uniform Standards of Professional Appraisal Practice (USPAP); keeping information confidential.
* Updates job knowledge by tracking current real estate values and property development potential, including land use restrictions; participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks; participating in professional organizations.
* Accomplishes organization goals by accepting ownership for accomplishing new and different requests; exploring opportunities to add value to job accomplishments.

title: Maintenance Renewal Sales Associate
description:
Kratos Space is a leader in assured aerospace communication solutions and services. We are cutting-edge innovators and creative problem solvers working collaboratively to solve our customers’ toughest challenges. Kratos is valued for our ability to design and deliver leading edge, resilient solutions for aerospace communication, control, awareness and mission success across a continuum of offerings – from commercial to tailored custom solutions and integrated programs. We bring both the capability and confidence that our customers value and depend on.
At Kratos, we encourage and entrepreneurial spirit balanced with fiscal and operation discipline. We work hard, we solve hard problems and we look out for and take care of our customers, each other and our families. Protecting and enabling our customer’s communication systems through innovative aerospace solutions is what motivates us.
We have an opportunity for a Sales Associate to join our Maintenance and Support (M&S) Sales team in Colorado Springs, CO focusing primarily on our Federal customers. As a Maintenance Renewal Sales Associate, you will help drive revenue growth across Kratos Space. You will be part of a small team of experienced sales representatives and will work with our Product and Solution Sales teams, Customer Service team, and Contracts team on a regular basis. You will have individual and/or team goals and will work to achieve and exceed these through maintaining an accurate pipeline. Primary responsibilities include administering and quoting Maintenance and Extended Warranty contracts and renewals, and communicating with customers via phone and email.

title: Project Manager
description:
Project Manager

	An ADP Client, Sherwood Design Engineers, is looking for a Project Manager to add to their team in Santa Cruz, CA 95062.

	Who we are:

	Sherwood Design Engineers: Engineering + Ecology + Creativity

	Sherwood is a site civil engineering practice committed to the optimal integration of ecology, infrastructure, and design/ We were established to provide a new generation of infrastructure services focused on both planning and implementation. The firm has implemented net-zero green building projects, district infrastructure, new street standards, and many sustainable civil projects throughout the world. Sherwood has worked on over thirty award-winning projects and has seen its work published internationally. 

	We specialize in sustainable infrastructure, water management strategies, green building design, and urban planning. Important to our engineering practice is our ability to span building and landscape. Our focus is on the conservation and management of the consumption of all site resources - Carbon, energy, water and waste. Sherwood works collaboratively with project teams to find ways to maximize efficiencies through an integrated and ecological approach that results in high performance buildings and landscapes recognized for function as well as aesthetics and user experience. 

	Are you ready to join the forefront of sustainable engineering? Sherwood Design Engineers is changing the way cities are built in the 21st Century. Help chart the course to a greener future as part of our dynamic, mission-driven Santa Cruz team!

	Essential Functions:
	* Budgetary, planning, scheduling, public relations, and technical activities related to broad range of engineering, administrative and other projects or programs. 
	* Develop and implement innovative design techniques that enhance the projects and the productivity of the assignments within the company. 
	* Motivate staff to excel in day-to-day work environment and maintain a creative spirit within a team.
	* Ensure engineering designs are following current applicable state & local regulations.
	* Work with a team of design engineers, CAD designer to assure Quality Assurance and Quality Control through various phases of projects.
	* Assist in preparing and reviewing requests for proposals and contracts.
	* Identify, contract and manage sub-consultants to include on projects.
	* Develop project Work Plans, manage project budget and performance.
	* Assist with the preparation of weekly duties and reporting that include: deliverables, milestones of current projects, proposals, staffing needs.
	* Review and identify current and potential discrepancies with budgets and contracts and cost overruns (i.e. timelines, work plans, etc.).
	* Monitor project billing and accounts receivable which includes direct communication with clients for collection efforts.
	* Reinforce the company’s core standards and expectations through mentoring, communication, and coaching.
	* Be able to fairly and accurately assess performance of staff members and participate in performance reviews.
	* Participate in recruiting and hiring collaboration with Human Resources.
	* Contribute to the company’s technological requirements through identifying technological solutions.
	* Contribute to the company’s strategic plan, through engaged leadership and results-oriented action plans.
	* Work closely with other Principals and other Project Managers.

	Job Qualifications:
	* Sign and stamp engineering documents.
	* A clear understanding of engineering designs of tasks and assignments, including problem analysis, concept, formulation, form development, integration, and review.
	* Demonstrates ability to develop and manage a team effectively while producing quantifiable results.
	* Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously while adhering to multiple schedules and deadlines.
	* Excellent interpersonal and organizational skills for working within an overall design team environment.
	* Effectively able to work well with others at all levels of the company; both on-site and remotely.
	* Ability to contact clients and manage professional relationships.
	* Maintains confidentiality and security of sensitive company information.
	* Must have strong and versatile computer drawing and design skills, excellent presentation and communication skills (verbal and written).
	* Must have digital and hand graphic skills and ability to grasp all technical interrelationships among the projects.
	* Ability to plan, organize, prioritize, multi-task and use time effectively.
	* Works independently under general supervision, uses initiative and good business judgment.
	* Ability to read and interpret written information including business documents, contracts, forms, email correspondence and follow instructions.
	* Ability to prepare analysis, reports, correspondence, and memos.
	* Reliable and responsible.
	* Maintains accurate and complete project records.
	* Be willing and able to travel frequently. 

	Skills and Experience:

	Education/Experience 
	* Bachelor of Science degree in Civil Engineering (environmental engineering preferred)
	* Licensure as a California Professional Engineer
	* 10 to 15 years’ experience
	* LEED Certification preferred

	Computer Skills:
	* Proficient in AutoCAD
	* Working knowledge of Windows, MS Office, Google Apps
	* Knowledge of GIS and Adobe Creative Suite preferred
	* Knowledge of civil design programs (Civil 3D, Hydro CAD, Flow master, Storm CAD, etc.) preferred.

	What we offer:
	* Competitive Pay; commensurate with experience
	* Health Insurance (Medical, Dental, Vision, Life)
	* PTO, Holiday Pay, Sick Pay

	Reasonable accommodations may be made to individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

	To Apply:

	Please submit your resume via the "APPLY NOW" button

	Equal Opportunity Employer

title: Inside Business Development Manager
description:
Aquila Solutions is a regulatory publishing partner and consultant for sponsors, tobacco and pharmaceutical companies that wish to submit applications to the FDA, EMEA, and Health Canada, for eventual marketing and sales. We work around the world and with clients that range from one person companies to global multi-nationals with thousands of employees.  We primarily cater to small to medium size businesses.
We are in search of an Inside Business Development Manager with strong interpersonal skills preferably with a sales background.  The role will develop and manage the market research and advertising for the company. They will be in charge of the "public face" of the company, which includes but is not limited to the website, industry conferences, phone calls, emails to clients, and social media sites.
 
This position is ideal for the individual who would like to develop and then run a Business Development group for a consulting firm.  The role will include a large amount of hands-on sales and marketing activities along with development activities.
 
Aquila offers a competitive compensation package including base salary, commission, bonus and a standard benefit plan.
There is a 90 day review period.  The role is located in Warner Robins, Ga.  It is an on-site role.  No relocation will be provided.

title: GIS Analyst
description:

Duration : 6 + Months
Job Type : C
Description : CADD/GIS Administrator 3 (CGA3) at PDA - This position will be extended into the new fiscal year , past 06/30/2020. This position is 37.5 hours a week. 
This resource will be managed by the Bureau of Information Technology and will focus on a project with the Bureau of Farmland Preservation. Having an enterprise system for managing the State’s farmland preservation process, the Bureau looks to include GIS technology to facilitate better visibility, communication, and approvals. Working with ArcGIS online and other State GIS tools, the candidate will build the submission and approval workflows, data layers, and ETL’s for the spatial portion of the preservation process. This work will include, in concert with Bureau staff, outreach and collaboration with County farmland preservation GIS and non-GIS staff. 
This resource will report directly to the Conservation and Environment Delivery Center GIS Director and will be expected to work independently and on various project teams. 
Specific Duties:
•Develop applications using ArcGIS Online templates
•Setup of replication and ETL processes to sync local and online databases
•GIS Database design and implementation
•Development, conversion and processing of GIS data to meet project needs
•Assist in the support and maintenance of existing applications
•Provide good communication with project County and State stakeholders
•Demonstrate and follow good security practices
•Work with developers and IT staff where necessary
The Hiring Manager is open to phone interviews for qualified candidates. 
Skills :
Develop applications using ArcGIS Online templates
Setup of replication and ETL processes to sync local and online databases
GIS Database design and implementation
experience working on Agile teams.?

title: Senior Mechanical Engineer
description:
Senior Mechanical Engineer 

	We are currently seeking an experienced Senior Mechanical Engineer to join our team in our New York, NY 10013 location.   

	Who We Are: 

	Founded in 2014, Clarapath’s mission is to transform the laboratory space and advance how hospitals provide laboratory care. Healthcare costs continue to sky-rocket and a foundational element to providing high-quality, low-cost, convenient care to patients requires constant innovation. Our company is strategically backed by one of the largest hospitals in the country, as well as visionary pharmaceutical and academic leaders. In collaboration with our partners, we hope to provide the next generation of patients with better care, as well as enable life-saving drugs for future generations. 

	From our fully-automated, precision sectioning technology to world-class imaging and analysis expertise, our team represents the future of digital pathology. To continue our track record of growth we are looking for the best talent, those who take the initiative, are self-directed learners, team players, have a passion for solving complex problems and those who want to make a societal impact.?We offer challenging opportunities to join a uniquely innovative company that straddles the worlds of medical devices, industrial automation and technology. To learn more about us, please visit us at [1] http://www.clarapath.com[2]  

	About the Role: 

	The Senior Mechanical Engineer will be working on medical device development as part of a tight knit development team. This role will be designing and selecting parts for the instrument as well as designing test fixtures for development; providing continuous feedback on the development process and accept feedback as well. The ideal candidate would have work experience in being part of engineering team building a medical device. We are looking for a team player who views medical device development as a competitive advantage. We are a rapidly growing business with opportunity for the right candidate to continue advancing their role and responsibilities as the company grows.  

	What you’ll do: 

	Core duties and responsibilities include the following.  Other duties may be assigned by management. 

	*        Designing precision motion stages and components, electromechanical system parts and assemblies in CAD environment 

	*        Generating drawings for parts and assemblies 

	*        Documentation 

	*        Modeling and simulation of design components, such as, dynamic system modeling, kinematic modeling, structural, and thermal analysis.  

	*        Building prototypes 

	*        Finding and managing vendors for prototyping and manufacturing 

	*        Creating test fixtures including instrumenting with data acquisition systems and programming 

	*        Unit and system testing of prototype designs 

	*        Role may require some travel 

	Our Perfect Candidate 

	Education and Experience: 

	*        BSc. in Mechanical, Aerospace, Biomedical Engineering or in an equivalent area 

	*        MUST have 6 years of experience in the field

	*        Medical device development 

	*        Design experience with microtomes or other precision sectioning mechanisms 

	*        Competency in designing large electromechanical system components 

	*        Proven design record 

	*        Analytical problem solution skills, such as modeling and simulations 

	*        Design experience on automation systems in web handling

	*        NO sponsorship is offered by the client

	Other Experiences and Knowledge: 

	*        Working with teams in multiple sites 

	*        Involvement in automation related extracurricular activities, such as, First Robotics

	*        Graduate degree in a related field with dissertation 

	*        Additive manufacturing, such as 3D printing 

	*        Histology laboratory workflow experience 

	Required Abilities and Skills:

	*        Strong interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills 

	*        Time management skills to prioritize and meet deadlines 

	*        Ability to work independently and as a member of a team 

	*        Flexibility to work in a changing and fast paced environment 

	*        Drive, determination and ability to hit aggressive milestones/deadlines 

	*        Proficiency in Microsoft Office Applications including Excel, PowerPoint, and Word 

	Company Offers:  

	*        Competitive salary will commensurate with experience and education 

	*        Comprehensive benefits package available: (healthcare, vision, dental and life insurances; 401k; PTO and holidays) 

	*        A collaborative and diverse work environment where our teams thrive on solving complex challenges. 

	*        Ability to file IP with the company 

	*        Connections with world class researchers and their laboratories 

	*        Collaboration with strategic leaders in healthcare and pharmaceutical world 

	*        A mission driven organization where every team member will be responsible for changing the standards of delivering healthcare 

	To Apply:  

	Please submit your cover letter and resume via the ‘Apply Now’ button! 

	Clarapath is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and strongly supports diversity in the workforce. Clarapath only accepts resumes from approved agencies that have a valid executed Non-Exclusive Master Staffing Agency Agreement with our company. Clarapath is not responsible for any fees or claims related to receipt of unsolicited resumes. 

	Keywords: Mechatronics, Electromechanical devices, Medical devices, CAD, Solidworks, Thermal

	Analysis, Microtome, Kinematic Modeling, Prototype Designs 


References

Visible links
1. http://www.clarapath.com/
2. http://www.clarapath.com/

title: Art Graphic Artist-Specialist
description:
Under the
direction of the Art Manager, the Graphic Artist Specialist processes customer
files, pre-flighting the jobs and preparing them for imaging directly to plate,
ensuring the highest quality products at the lowest possible cost, while
meeting customer delivery requirements, in accordance with company policies and
procedures.
Act as a technical resource
to Multi-Color Corporation and its customers.
 
Receive customer
files. Pre-flight the files according to departmental procedures, checking for
trapping, overprinting, proper resolution, color corrections, and building
proper files for output. Convert to CMYK as required. 
Ensure files meet
customer specifications, make any necessary corrections, and output proofs. 
Check proofs for
accuracy. Send directly to plate. 
Ensure job has
been checked by customer. 
Archive jobs for
possible future use. 
Read and
understand all job requirements before beginning desktop process. 
Copy all
information to be used from customer’s disk. 
Ensure trapping
is correct. 
Position copy
according to specifications. 
Proofread and
approve orders.
Ask questions,
reports all problems, and performs all necessary clean-up and corrections
before files are released for film output. 
Compare completed
digital file to job order before releasing. 
Interface with
customers, the sales department, customer service and other MCC employees to
address and resolve any problems. 
Participate on
cross functional teams to ensure the continuous, on-going improvement of
processes, methods, productivity and quality, while reducing costs. 
Maintain
technical competency and remain current in technology and changes in the
industry. 
Complete and
maintain all required paperwork, records, documents, etc. 
Follow and comply with
all safety and work rules and regulations. Maintain departmental housekeeping
standards.
 
1 – 2 years printing experience is highly desired
Proficient with
PC & MAC computers.
Excellent
knowledge of proper grammar, spelling, punctuation & composition.
Possess a
‘can-do’ and TEAMWORK attitude.
Careful attention
to detail and high expectation for quality.
Follows and
understand quality guidelines. 
Add, subtract,
multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common
fractions, and decimals. Able to read and use a ruler.
Specific vision
abilities required by this job include close vision, color vision, and ability
to adjust focus.
Must understand
printing tolerances.
Develop and work
within department guidelines to allow transfer of projects between functional
areas.
Initiate
opportunities for process improvements.
Quiet conditions; may encounter moderate noise
when in manufacturing environment and will be required to wear hearing, foot,
and/or other personal protective equipment while performing duties in a
manufacturing setting.
While performing
the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit for extended
periods, lift up to 5lbs, speak on the telephone, and use hands and fingers for
writing/using a keyboard/mouse.
Some
standing, walking, lifting, and/or move up to 40 lbs. may be required.
Specific vision abilities required by this
job include close vision, ability to adjust focus, and color differentiation,
along with the ability to view computer screen for extended periods of time.

title: Telecom Engineer
description:
Job Title: Telecom Engineer
Location: Auburn Hills, MI
Duration: 12 Months Contract 
Under the general client that meets the needs of the organization. The position is responsible for 3rd level operational engineering & support including planning, design, and implementation of hardware, applications and operating systems per the Client Telecommunications policy. This position will create documentation, standards and policies for junior members of the engineering and operations teams, overseeing their training and auditing as necessary to ensure that they are followed. This position provides a timely response to the approved business unit, developer, and administrator community requests for assistance including project support. The position requires participation in 24-hour on-call support, after-hours scheduled changes as needed, and to resolve telecommunications problems/issues. In addition to verifying organizational compliance with established policies and procedures, the this role will be responsible for ensuring the health and stability of all telephony equipment and services, including PBX, Voice Servers, Voice Mail servers, adjunct Voice systems, CMS, voice circuits, IVR, 1-800 numbers via SOMOS and telephony monitoring tools.
This role will also provide 3rd level operational telephony network support for 60+ VWGoA sites and the 14+ VWGoA Contact Center communities:
• Provide telephony architectural design for all future data telephony deployments
• Reviews industry best practices to create reliable telephony voice over internet protocol (VoIP) solutions.
• Ensures all the entire telephony environment is maintained in accordance with VWGoA’s life cycle policies.
• Reviews complex business requirements, identifies and proposes solutions based on existing in-house capabilities including determining how existing solutions can be extended to the current requirement. If solutions do not exist in-house, this role will be responsible for investigating and proposing potential solutions.
• Informs management of critical issues that may affect clients or the infrastructure and provides recommendations for mitigation.
• Works with commercial telephony product vendors in the design and evaluation of telephony network products and technology, and troubleshooting activities.
• Involved in a wide range of issues including secure architectures, VoIP traffic, virtual private networks, local area networks, wireless local area networks and unified communications.
• Interfaces and supports incident resolution with 1st and 2nd level support teams on all severity 1 & 2 problems, and spearheads resolution for all telephony problems
• Interfaces and participates with Client Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT) as needed to analyze and respond to CERT messages and mitigate risks as appropriate.
• Maintains required documentation for all telephony network activities.
Required Qualifications:
Formal Education or Equivalent:
• Bachelor’s degree or equivalent real life experience in Telecommunications
• Multiple Avaya Certifications including ASPS & ACSS (Aura & Breeze/Oceana)
• Other Certifications in related technologies a plus (i.e. Redhat, Cisco, MCSE, ITIL, etc.)
Certifications/Years of Experience:
• 20+ years of related experience
• 15 years’ experience working as a VAR in support of Avaya solutions a plus
Demonstrable Work Experience with each of the following:
• Strong written and verbal communication skills
• Experience in designing and supporting all aspects of Contact Centers using Omnichannel communications, IVR, speech analytics, call recording, workforce management and other associated solutions.
• Must have experience with Avaya Aura PBX solutions. CM 6.3 and above, Avaya /Verint Workforce optimization (WFO)
• Experience with CRM / Salesforce integration, CTI and other application integrations
• Deep understanding of SIP & SIP Trunking and other VoIP protocols such as H.323
Basic Skills
1. Problem Solving- creating options and solutions
2. Root cause analysis using tools like “5-whys” and DFMEA concepts to permanently resolve issues
3. Analytical Thinking- using logic and reason
4. Persuasion / Motivation- moving others to action
5. Mentoring / Training abilities – able to share knowledge effectively and teach others.
6. Leadership Skills – ability to lead team efforts during project implementation. Includes tasking junior team members

title: Java Software Engineer
description:
Vicor Corporation is a leading manufacturer of high tech modular power supply components and systems for a variety of industries.  Our world class automated “mass customization” manufacturing facility, located in Andover Mass, is integrated, controlled, and monitored by our in-house custom developed Computer Integrated Manufacturing (CIM) software systems, which integrates our systems to automated manufacturing equipment. 
Software projects involve Java/Spring/Struts, Java web technology, Oracle, HTML/XML, JavaScript/Ajax, SOA/WSDL, and LINUX.   Our highly skilled team leverages a strong base of reusable software libraries and in depth advanced Mfg. systems experience, together with powerful open source toolsets.  Projects are very diverse, challenging, fast paced, and involve a variety of skills including database, user interface, real-time device communications, event-driven multi-threaded mfg. control applications, Web/Intranet, data warehousing, and dashboard techniques.  End users are located in our same building.

Daniel Moody, P.A. is seeking an experienced civil litigation paralegal or legal assistant to work remotely for an established Pinellas County AV-rated law firm with a state-wide construction law and commercial litigation practice. May be negotiable as to full or part time schedule if needed.
Must be proficient in both Word Perfect and Word, as well as in Excel. Working knowledge or prior experience with Amicus Online is a plus. Must have good written and oral communication skills for extensive interaction with the firm’s clients, other attorneys’ offices and the court’s Judicial Assistants. Must be able to work independently, have excellent organization skills and be detail-oriented.
? Opening files and linking file contacts in Amicus.
? Drafting basic pleadings. Extensive library of samples available to conform to required format.
? Filing lawsuits, including preparing summons, having summons issued by the Clerk’s Office, and coordinating with the process server for service of process. 
? Drafting and filing basic discovery requests and discovery responses. Extensive library of samples available to conform to required format.
? Drafting and filing basic motions.
? Calendar management - scheduling and setting conferences, hearings, deposition, mediation and trial/arbitration.
? Preparing transmittal and cover letters and e-mails.
? Case/File management - calendaring deadlines, keeping Amicus Case File Summary up to date as to case status, monitoring case status and readiness for trial/arbitration, attaching all file related documents to proper Amicus file.
? Preparation, issuance and coordination of service of subpoenas for deposition, trial/arbitration.
? Document management - converting various document file formats to Adobe .pdf, scanning, electronic Bates stamping, review and organization of large quantities of documents for potential use at conferences, deposition, mediation, hearings and trial/arbitration.
? Assisting with preparation for conferences, mediation, deposition, hearings and trial/arbitration.
? Construction claim of lien preparation - review of online Official Records and Property Appraiser Offices’ records, preparation of draft of construction liens, notices of nonpayment, and demand letters for attorney review and signature, using extensive forms library and resources. Recording of liens and satisfactions of lien and service of liens and correspondence by certified mail.
? Occasional assistance at deposition, major hearings, mediation and trial/arbitration.
? Other administrative duties as assigned.
Working remotely. Salary and other benefits are negotiable based upon experience and individual needs. 
E-mail resume, including all related job experience, professional references with contact information and cover letter to dmoody@danielmoodylaw.com. You can also fax to 727-596-3006.
You can learn more about the law firm at www.danielmoodylaw.com

title: YOUTH CARE WORKER
description:
We are currently hiring for all of our 7 locations throughout the Phoenix Metropolitan area. Areas including Phoenix, Mesa, Glendale and Youngtown!
Job Summary:
The Youth Care Worker (YCW) is responsible for providing direct care supervision to the youths residing in Southwest Key Programs (SWK) care fostering an environment that facilitates learning and behavioral management in a supportive manner. The Youth Care Worker will maintain a flexible, organized, and efficient work schedule. 
Essential Functions:
Other Functions:
Qualifications and Requirements:
Preferred
Food Handler's Card (May be required for those Programs in which Youth Care Worker Staff Provide Meal Preparation and/or Meal Serving for Children in Care) 
Physical Demands:
Must be able to obtain Crisis Prevention Institute (CPI) certification and First Aid Certification (CPR). Must be able to supervise clients indoors and outdoors throughout the entire duration of their shift period, which lasts 8 hours or more on a typical shift. Must be able to stand, bend, or stoop for the entire duration of the shift, as necessary. Must be prepared and physically able to respond with appropriate protocol in a variety of dynamic supervision situations with clients of 0-17 years in age. In a sudden or emergency event, staff must be at all times physically able to run, jump, lunge, twist, push, pull, apply SWK-approved Physical Intervention techniques and otherwise manage or coerce the full weight of an adolescent. All staff must be physically and mentally able to manage youth who become uncooperative, sick, violent, or display any other form of harmful or threatening behavior. Must be prepared to administer emergency First Aid, CPR or CPI techniques to clients, regardless of the time of day or hour of the staff’s shift, the size of the client, or the staff’s level of personal fatigue. Staff must be able to maintain clarity of thought throughout the entirety of a shift and be able to respond quickly to duress or circumstances requiring immediate action. 
Work Environment:
This is a twenty-four hour residential facility at which minors receive multiple services. There are three shifts per twenty-four hour period. Hours and duties of work shifts are subject to change. The noise levels varies from mild to moderate. Employees and clients may be exposed to prevalent weather conditions. Position is required to eat client meals during shift with the clients.

title: Sr. QA_React/React Native
description:
Sr. Quality Analyst is expected to maintain and write automated test cases, as well as create automation frameworks. Creation of test cases are based off user stories. The candidate will create reports, test the app from a design and usability perspective and support testing throughout the life-cycle of the product. The QA Automation Engineer will be expected to work in a dynamic, interactive and global team, communicate efficiently and effectively and always be ready to support their peers.
* Create and maintain test plans for new and existing features of Mobile/Web applications developed in React Native/React JS
* You will be working across multiple technologies, our frontend (React/Redux site, React-Native app), as well as our backend (node.js) and database (mongoDB).
* Review features in development and can identify incomplete specifications or prospective testing risks
* Maintain and Execute automated test scripts, as well as create automation frameworks
* Keep all stakeholders updated on the status of testing and communicate any blockers or delays when testing through reporting and metrics
• Design and build automation frameworks for Mobile/Web applications developed in React Native/React JS
• Create automated integration cases for native mobile device applications / iOS and Android mobile platforms.
• 3+ years of hands on experience using mobile testing frameworks such as XCode, XCTest, XCUITest, Appium, Android Studio,
• 3+ years of hands on experience in any API automation testing tools – Selenium, HP UFT/QTP, SOAP UI, Postman.
• Design, develop, and maintain UI Automation Scripts in C#/SpecFlow/Cucumber.
• 2+ years of experience on load testing using JMeter/VSLoadTest/BlazeMeter.
• Basic coding and debugging skills on microsoft dot net/c#/java/Java script code using visual studio/vs code.
• Experience working with continuous integration tools. (TFS, Jenkins, Bamboo, etc.)
• Translate functional requirements and use cases into clear, concise, detail-oriented test plans/cases
• Experience working in an agile environment and knowledge of Scrum/SAFe methodologies will be advantage.
• Docker & Azure Cloud experience will have additional advantage.
• Strong verbal and written communication skills in English

title: Business Manager (HQ)
description:
aXseum seeks a full-time Business Manager to assist the aXseum HQ team, located in Vienna, VA, in the areas of Contracts, Quality and Business Development. 
Essential Duties: 
1. Perform the contractual management of day to day operations of Government and Commercial contracts environment, to include GSA schedule, BPA's, IDIQ's, GWAC, sole-source and competitive stand-alone bids.
2. Monitor compliance of all related contracts pertaining to the FAR, and other relative regulations, policies, and laws.
3. Track project milestones and deliverables. Proactively manage changes in project, identify potential risks, report to Program manager and carry out contingency plans if necessary.
4. Interact with personnel and management at all levels concerning matters of significance to the company related to cost proposals. Will interact and coordinate with other business management leaders and staff on a daily basis, to adhere to a standardized pricing review process for consistency and quality control.
5. Negotiate, author and administer teaming and subcontract agreements to include purchase orders and performance monitoring.
6. Serve as HQ advisor and coordinate all practices related to CMMI appraisal. Maintain documentation and ensure standards are met. 
7. Liaise with ISO 9000 organization and ISO consultant to ensure continuous compliance and maintenance of our ISO 9000 certification. Maintain all necessary ISO records including Quality Management System (QMS). Lead preparation of yearly ISO audits and semi-annual internal reviews.
8. Estimate the resources and participants needed to achieve project goals. Determine and assess need for additional staff and/or consultants and make the appropriate report of findings to Program Manager.
9. May build, develop, and grow any business relationships vital to the success of the project.
10. May assist with major proposals, and initiatives to include Color Team reviews and BOE requirements.
11. May perform related duties as assigned. 
Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities: 
1. Ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing. 
2. Knowledge of pricing and contracts in federal contracting.
3. Strong organization skills and ability to manage deadlines. 
4. Working knowledge of a variety of contract types, comprehensive working knowledge of procurement regulations.
5. Knowledge and proficiency in, but not limited to, the use of Microsoft Office computer programs, web-based applications, the Internet, and other electronic resources.
Minimum Education and Experience: 
1. Bachelor's Degree is required. Degree in Business or a related field is preferred. Additional Government Contracting work experience may be substituted for a degree with one year of experience equal to thirty (30) semester hours. 
2. Demonstrated work experience with ISO practices and participation in successful ISO audits is required. Experience maintaining QMS is preferred. 
3. Demonstrated advanced work experience with Microsoft Excel and Word. 
4. Current CMMI Associate certification is highly preferred.
aXseum Inc. and its subcontractors shall abide by the requirements of 41CFR 60-1.4(a), 60-300.5(a) and 60-741.5(a). These regulations prohibit discrimination against qualified individuals based on their status as protected veterans or individuals with disabilities, and prohibit discrimination against all individuals based on their race, color, religion, sex, or national origin. Moreover, these regulations require that covered prime contractors and subcontractors take affirmative action to employ and advance in employment individuals without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, protected veteran status or disability.

title: Borough Engineer
description: BOROUGH ENGINEER  The Borough of Grafton is accepting applications for the position of Borough Engineer. The applicant must possess a BS in Civil Engineering, be a registered Professional Engineer in Pennsylvania and have a good working knowledge of streets and utilities. In addition, knowledge of ArcGIS and related ESRI GIS programs is a must as they pertain to sanitary and storm sewer design and maintenance. Familiarity with other computer applications also required. Responsibilities include (but not limited to) review of development plans for compliance with local building, fire and zoning codes; development of detailed engineering plans and project management of public works and road projects; review of construction bids; enforcement of the codified ordinances of the Borough and other duties as determined by the Council and Manager. Strong communication skills including public speaking and a working knowledge of local government are strongly preferred - traffic engineering experience also a plus. The successful candidate must have a valid driver's license and mobility to travel around areas throughout the Borough as needed. title: Inventory Control Clerk
description:
EMCOR Facilities Services (EFS), an EMCOR core business, services over 1 billion square feet of space worldwide. From corporate campuses to single sites, EFS provides a range of services that support mission-critical areas of financial services, manufacturing, pharmaceutical, transportation, and government sectors.
The Inventory & Delivery Assistant will support the Assistant Facilities Manager in a safe, efficient and professional manner.  Responsibilities include compiling and maintaining daily and weekly quantity count of inventory.  Verifies and reports when stock is needs to be replenished.  Submits daily and weekly inventory reports to the Assistant Facilities Manager. Deliver or coordinate delivery of items as directed by management or by work order request. Point of contact for deliveries to the warehouse.  Other duties include, but not limited to, daily assessments of accumulation point, maintaining environment, and other various duties as assigned by the Assistant Manager or the Maintenance Managers, while adhering to all safety and health standards. The Inventory and Delivery Assistant is also responsible for following all processes to support client satisfaction.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to sit; reach with hands and arms; climb or balance; and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The incumbent is required to lift weights manually or by forklift. Because of the danger involved in lifting weights, safety shoes are worn to protect toes. The individual also is required to bend, stoop, climb, and pull in unloading trucks, stacking shipments, and delivering the merchandise. In exercising these functions, the individual must be able to exert in excess of 50 lbs. of force frequently, and/or in excess of 20 lbs. of force constantly to move objects.
The working environment is fast paced.

Rate: plus expenses possible flex for strong candidate
Visa: H1B ok  NO TRANSFERS (communication needs to be 10/10)
 
 
Second Line is definitely applied a bit inconsistently across the industry, but the basics here are that First Line own and operate the processes and controls that the business run on (so they write, implement, and operate the policies, procedures, and control environment), while Second Line looks over their shoulders to opine on whether those policies, procedures, and control environment are designed appropriately to cover all the relevant risks (all types of risk – compliance/regulatory risk, financial risk, and operational risk).  If the whole Second Line function were to disappear, all the processes to safely operate the company should still be able to function.  So Second Line is the group that’s performing checks (risk assessments and risk monitoring) as well as providing effective challenge (a risk-focused review) of the policies, procedures, and controls designed and operated by the first line.
 
Skills:
 
MUST HAVES
 
Skills – hopefully visible in resume:
o             Measured in years, not months
o             PCI experience itself is not being accepted for the FSI piece
 
Travel
 
When submitting, please include:
o             Provide a description of their background with second line at a financial services institution
o             If higher level candidates (former management, CISO)
o             Confirm they are open to hands-on roles where their day-to-day tasks will be directed and observed by a manager
o             Include candidate’s response to following question: “How much of their cumulative experience was spent in the trenches doing the work?”
 
Communication – Must be 10/10
 
Experience performing second line effective challenge / risk assessment in FSI, along with solid Information Security technical experience (meaning hands-on technology work); Knowledge of FFIEC Handbooks, NIST CSF, NIST 800-53 risk frameworks and others.  Experience designing and evaluating InfoSec processes, risks and controls.
 
- 50% - Solid Cyber/InfoSec Control Procedure, Control Development and Control governance framework experience (e.g. NIST CSF, COBIT 2019)
- 25% - Vulnerability Management, Security Configuration Management (e.g. Firewalls, Web Proxies, Intrusion Detection/Intrusion Prevention), Encryption, or Cyber Incident Response
- 25% - Cyber/InfoSec Process development/review and challenge (covering Process, Risk, Control Inventory work)

title: Post Doc/Scientist I, Antibody Discovery

The ideal candidate will have in-depth and hands-on expertise in molecular biology, biochemistry and other related disciplines. The candidate must be able to work both independently and collaboratively in a matrixed environment to design, execute, interpret and communicate molecular biology studies for one or more projects utilizing good scientific judgment and strong team skills. Will report to Scientist II position.
Immunomic Therapeutics is looking for highly motivated Post Doc/Scientist with experience in hybridoma-based antibody discovery and development. The scientist is expected to performing the antibody screening with ELISA and/or Flow cytometry; DNA/protein sequence analysis of hybridoma hits; and the antibody functional evaluation.

title: Smarts Admin Developer
description:
We are looking for resources for an engagement in Canada for a customer.This is to configure Smarts to monitor a customer's Equipment Ascend platform for the Gov't of Ontario.
 Smarts admin developer proficient in ASL scripting and Dynamic Modelling - expert level skills (5-10 years of experience)
General implementation tasks are completed early on in effort to ensure project delivery time-frames that meets expectations and that provides a "quick-win for our client. These general services for development and implementation include:
- Review operational objectives from client stakeholders.
- Analysis of current data input files for development of parsing and general solution.
- Analysis of current customerdiscovery results for instantiation of customer objects in Smarts.
- Review of any best practices or policies that our client requires for contractors.
- Discuss the approach for the client maintaining the solution long-term.
- Discuss any challenges with accessibility (security, access, etc.) that could impact current engagement efforts or deliverables.
- Analyze and plan for any production deployment constraints (production scheduling, change windows, etc.) that could impact deployment.
- Build and compile models and Classes in Smarts for customerContainers and Zones.
- Leverage input file sourced by NetIQ for object instantiation of Containers and Zones.
- Leverage customerOID and SNMP instrumentation for discovery and object instantiation as potential supplement to asset identification/discovery/sourcing.
-Create and instantiate new Classes in Smarts for creating instances using input data.
-Compile new models into Smarts monitoring platform (SAM, IP).
-Build/develop Driver in Smarts for establishing topology across customerZones and Containers.
-Establish Parser and parsing logic for data input.
-The developed Parser will process the input (file or discovery) and call the driver in Smarts to instantiate the model and create instances in Smarts. The logic will also establish the relationships between customerZones and the underlying Containers.
Regards
Divyansh Srivastava

title: Graphic Specialist/Web Designer
description:
Pegasus Technologies & Solutions, Inc. is seeking to hire a Graphics Specialist/SharePoint Web Designer. This candidate will be responsible for Graphic/Visual Communications and SharePoint development for the Project Manager, Unmanned Aircraft Systems (PM UAS), located on Redstone Arsenal.  Duties include the oversight and coordination with outside vendors in order to meet specified goals.  Required skills include: graphic design, creation of high-end publications, presentations, branding, video, multi-media, photography, animation, 3D graphics, and SharePoint website design/development.  Performs analysis of customer requests and needs, and works independently from drafting of the initial rough concept phase through creation and delivery of the final product.
Graphic design includes:
• The creation of logos, illustrations, briefings, desktop publishing, and maintenance of brand uniformity throughout the organization in support of PM UAS.  Final products range from display graphics for trade shows, illustrations for publications and briefings, business cards, building signage, Change of Charter programs, invitations and photography, cd/dvd creation, duplication and printing, and document production. 
• Responsible for creative concept, design, layout, collection of articles/photos, editing and printing of the PM UAS Newsletter and the quarterly PM UAS Magazine, as applicable. 
• Collects information and compiles video for PM UAS “Update to the Workforce”. 
• Video/multi-media duties range from the initial capturing of video to producing an edited, finished product which may either be used in other videos, Town Hall Meetings, or may stand alone. Tasks associated include video recording, editing, sound editing, and title production. 
• Photography tasks include documenting Change of Charters, retirements, PM UAS events, ISO photos, passport photos, equipment photos, and vehicle demonstrations. 
• 3D graphics include constructing the 3D models, setting scenes, lighting, animation, and rendering.
SharePoint/Web design includes:
• Design and development of custom web pages within the framework of the existing PM UAS Intranet Site, which is based on SharePoint. 
Required Qualifications:
• Proficient with MS Office, SharePoint, and Adobe Software
• Excellent written and verbal communications skills
• High School Diploma, Bachelor’s Degree preferred 
• 5-7 years of directly related work experience 
• US Citizenship is required
• Active secret clearance, or the ability to obtain one will be required
Pegasus is an equal opportunity employer.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, union status and/or beliefs, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

title: Web Application Developer
description:
We are seeking a talented Web Application Developer to develop, maintain and enhance complex database centric web application software in support of U.S. Army scientific research objectives. This position will be on-site with our Army customer and require familiarity with a broad set of web software development and software engineering skills.  The developer will be the lead responsible for maintaining and extending a set of custom web-based applications written in PHP and using SQL to interact with data in a MySQL database. The PHP applications are written using the CakePHP framework so experience with this is preferred, but previous use of other similarly structured programming frameworks is acceptable.
The developer will be the lead responsible for maintaining and extending a set of custom web-based applications written in PHP and using SQL to interact with data in a MySQL database. The PHP applications are written using the CakePHP framework so experience with this is preferred, but previous use of other similarly structured programming frameworks is acceptable.
The existing applications include capabilities for:
Inserting, modifying and deleting data into the database with associated error checking.
Loading externally generated Excel data files into the MySQL database.
Providing process for a variety of needs which in most cases include the uploading of user files and automated generation of PDF documents email notifications providing for review and approvals of a variety of work flows throughout the organization.
Generating a variety of reports for on-screen display and also for on demand Excel file generation.
Generating onscreen graphs.
This position will enhance and extend these existing capabilities.
Due to the sensitivity of customer related requirements, U.S. Citizenship is required.
Experience with database centric business web applications.
Minimum of 5 years of experience directly with development of database centric web applications or 10 years of more general web application development experience with 2 years of experience with database centric web applications.
Proficiency with PHP, SQL and familiarity with the MySQL database software.
PHP Web development framework.
The programmer must also be able to interact with stakeholders to identify and decompose system requirements. 
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Experience with CakePHP web development framework preferred.
Experience with team programming and structured programming experience preferred.

description:
Designs and develops interfaces and solutions for web pages, sites, and services within the public and private web sites for Business & Support Services Division, MR. Interprets and refines user requirements, designs technical site plans, test plans, database use, layouts, navigation and other technical specifications. Develops site functionality, features, navigation, user interface, backend connectivity, access, security and change management utilizing specified web development tools.
Plans and performs web development tasks to include programming, integration of reusable code and database; conducts job estimates; implements quality control measures. Incorporates text, graphics, pictures, objects, video, sounds, and all required media enhanced effects as required.
Conducts site maintenance, troubleshooting and problem solving. Maintains high level of proficiency with prescribed development tools and products. Conducts research for web design and development, to include tools, technologies and methodologies, and makes recommendations. Collaborates with the customer and Business Analyst, other web developers, web designers, web administrator, application developers, database designers and other technical staff as appropriate to deliver web-based products and services.
Plans, organizes work, and follows internal procedures and resources to ensure maximum productivity and economies. Monitors programs on a regular basis, and initiates corrective action to ensure support of operating programs. Develops long-range plans in conjunction with internal operating directives.
Effectively supports the Marine Corps Equal Employment Opportunity and Sexual Harassment policies, and ensures compliance with fire, safety, and other environmental issues and programs. Maintains and enforces security of funds, merchandise, supplies and equipment to preclude or minimize the potential for fraud, waste and abuse.
Provides World Class Customer Service with an emphasis on courtesy. Assists customers and communicates positively in a friendly manner. Takes action to solve problems quickly. Alerts the higher level supervisor, or proper point of contact for help when problems arise.
Adheres to safety regulations and standards. Promptly reports any observed workplace hazards, and any injury, occupational illness, and/or property damage resulting from workplace mishaps to the immediate supervisor. Adheres to established standards of actively supporting the principles of the EEO program and prevention of sexual harassment. This is a white-collar position where occasional lifting up to 20 lbs may be required.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field and four years web application development experience, leveraging modern web standards such as HTML5, ASP.Net, JQuery, JavaScript, SQL, PowerShell, XML, CSS and client side development in JavaScript or any JavaScript framework.
Or an appropriate combination of education and experience that demonstrates possession of knowledge, skills and experience equivalent to that gained above. Both Web Forms and MVC experience will be considered. Experience with third party control vendors such as Telerik or DevExpress is highly desirable.
Knowledge of SharePoint 2010/2013 to include administration and development. Thorough understanding of SharePoint architecture to include farm topology, managed paths, site collections, and other related topics.
Candidate familiarity with SharePoint taxonomy, metadata, content management, collaboration, custom web part development, reporting, and search services. Planning and implementing SharePoint disaster recovery solutions. Previous experience as an Administrator and Workflow development is a plus.
Knowledge of Server Administration to include Web server / IIS administration. Experience with Web Service Development, such as REST API Web service. Experience with database design and development, and mobile or online shopping site development is a plus.

title: Web Developer (.NET / Cloud)
description:
Web Developer (.NET / Cloud) - Contract - Beaverton, OR 
The end client is unable to sponsor or transfer visas for this position; all parties authorized to work in the US without sponsorship are encouraged to apply.
A Financial Company is seeking a Web Developer (.NET / Cloud) in Beaverton, OR. 
Role Description
* Develops and reviews requirements, ensuring that there is agreement on what software is to be built.
* Synthesizes design, incorporates review comments and provide critical review of other designs.
* Often responsible for creating and documenting the architecture and design for several interrelated components, which are subsequently developed by other engineers.
* Writes production-quality code and is able to implement entire subsystems or feature sets independently. Software developed should have very few defects, should be robust in the face of environmental errors, should perform at or beyond requirements, and should be able to be understood by more junior developers.
* Builds and tests code to validate functionality against requirements.
* Facilitates code inspections and design reviews. Mentors others on software development practice.
* Participates in establishing large and/or complex project goals, milestones and timetables.
* Accurately estimates and tracks personal work. Helps other engineers create accurate estimates.
* Communicates accurate status to managers and project managers.
* Coordinates work with project managers and other engineers. Develops and maintains strong relations with clients, partners, peers and other associates.
* Identifies project responsibilities outside of the standard implementation process and coordinates with the appropriate area.
* Assists in the development and presentation of manuals, user guides, and other materials relating to client products.
* May provide staff and clients with training and technical assistance relating to new, existing, and revised products.
* Provides post-release support to internal and external customers.
* Helps identify closed loop corrective action for removing process defects in the software development life cycle.
* Demonstrates self-development by attending courses and conferences. Routinely presents topics and training to other software developers..
Skills & Requirements
* Four-year degree plus graduate work in software engineering, computer science, computer engineering or equivalent experience is required. During this time should have written programs of significant complexity (several thousand lines).
* At least 7 years' experience writing software in a production environment, preferably in product development setting. Software development experience should include distributed server solutions with rigorous quality, scalability, robustness and reliability requirements.
* At least 4 years' experience with Microsoft technology stack (.NET, C#, RESTful API Web Services, ASP.NET, etc)
* At least 4 years' experience with Cloud Computing technologies (Azure, AKS, GCP, etc)
* Proven practical experience with software product development/management processes and software configuration management.
* Proven project or sub-project technical leadership. Experienced with project management tools and techniques. Able to manage multiple tasks and meet assigned deadlines.
* Ability to assess and inspect coding practices and review software designs.
* Good interpersonal and written communication skills
Why Hays?
You will be working with a professional recruiter who has intimate knowledge of the Information Technology industry and market trends . Your Hays recruiter will lead you through a thorough screening process in order to understand your skills, experience, needs, and drivers. You will also get support on resume writing, interview tips, and career planning, so when there's a position you really want, you're fully prepared to get it. 
Additionally, this position is a contract role where Hays offers you the opportunity to enroll in full medical, dental or vision benefits.

title: A234- Lead  Full Stack Web Developer
description:
Please note that this is a 5 months contract position  with a possibility of extension to 1 year. 
JOB SUMMARY:
Provides high level of expertise in the architectural design of business applications; Understands the business objectives, processes, and products and how best can be supported by technology; Works with the Global Architecture team closely to drive architectural solutions for specific applications; Responsible for the conceptual design of business applications; Reviews and validates the detailed technical design for business applications provided by the supplier; Validates suppliers estimates; Performs impact analysis of changes across multiple system and provides Rough Order of Magnitude; Recommends integration and parallel testing criteria; Mentors lower level colleagues.
ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:
• Understands customers’ processes and products and how they fit within the goals of the business unit
• Reviews and validates the detailed technical design for business applications provided by the supplier to ensure alignment with business requirements
• Validates suppliers estimates Estimates Rough Order of Magnitude for the level of effort/cost of new application functionality
• Performs quality review checks on project deliverables
• Acts as liaison between Business and IT, as assigned
• Supports users in building Business Case, including cost / benefit analysis, risk assessment, project scope, and development of a high level plan
• Supports the implementation activities, troubleshooting system environmental issues, training as required
• Performs impact analysis of application changes across various components, holding an end-to-end view of the system
• Specifies / Recommends Integration and Parallel testing criteria
• Is responsible for the conceptual design of business applications
• Mentors lower level colleagues
• Works closely with GiTAG in driving architectural solutions for specific applications (e.g., Application architectural models, frameworks, middleware, etc.
• Additional Tasks: Responds to application problem tickets as necessary
TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS:
• 12+ years overall development experience
• Most recent 5-7+ years experience in HTML, HTML5, CSS, CSS3, JavaScript, jQuery, Bootstrap, ES6, AJAX.
• Most recent 5-7+ years experience in building Single Page Application (SPA) framework such as AngularJS, Angular5/6/7, Vue.js
• Must have familiarity/experience with Java 11 and Angular 8
• Experience in back-end technologies: Java, Spring Boot, Node.JS, Restful web services
• Good Web Application debugging skills using Chrome Developers Tool and Firebug
• Strong understanding of web-based technologies like JSON, REST, Web Services
• Experience with Webpack, Gulp, Grunt and NPM Packages
Applicants must provide their phone number. Reference job number A234.

New opportunity for PHP Software Development Engineers with a fast growing company in Highlands Ranch providing real time interactive large scale streaming and telephonic IP broadcast communications services.
 
RESPONSIBILITIES
* Supporting the existing LAMP based application and infrastructure. Finding areas for improvement, suggesting changes, and owning those changes.
* Utilizing and assisting our Quality Assurance team to make and release the best software possible.
* Helping the Operations team maintain the quality of our platform events that our partners and clients have come to expect. 
* Ensuring the smooth operation of the platform during high stress, high congestion moments.
* Being a vital resource for other engineers, quality assurance engineers, and leadership. 
REQUIRED EXPERIENCE and QUALIFICATIONS
* More than two years experience with PHP in a development environment and a desire to become expert in all things PHP.
* Expertise with frontend development: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery and/or any of the JS frameworks.
* Knowledgeable with Classes, interfaces, design patterns, encapsulation, inheritance, polymorphism and object-oriented programming.
* Familiar with working in an Agile software development environment
* Must be a natural communicator with other developers, IT support team, management, business analysts, marketing and other non tech staff.
* Record of taking ownership of a feature or application from concept through release while assisting others when the need arises.
* Experience working with QA doing Unit and automated testing.
* Some familiarity with Python and node JS would be advantageous

description:

description:
